company: AgilePoint was created by a team of driven people who strive to incorporate the principles of relentless innovation for the benefit of our customers. Our mission is to help enterprises of any size attain and sustain operational success through process excellence. AgilePoint NX is a future-proof, Digital Transformation aPaaS (Application Platform as a Service) that combines the speed and agility of a leading Low-Code platform with enterprise-class BPM capabilities. AgilePoint NX empowers citizen developers to build any kind of app, from simple to complex, without writing code. In addition, AgilePoint NX is extensible. Professional developers can create custom functions and APIs to extend drag-and-drop actions in AgilePoint NX. This capability further empowers citizen developers. AgilePoint NX redefines the boundaries of rapid application development.

company: Unisys India Pvt. Ltd.
description: Job description   We Believe in Better!     We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.     What success looks like in this role:       The success lies for a Business Analyst in the fact that one has to wear multiple hats while working for AI/ML projects- probably that of Business Analyst, Domain Expert and Business Architect.      Responsible for gathering, eliciting and validating requirements     Help the team on impact assessment of changes and new requirements     Create and maintain the requirement traceability matrix     Responsible for assessing functional test cases     Be an active participant for requirement clarification and defect analysis     Provide adequate support to enable PMs to develop robust project plans and estimate Change Request work     Consult with the clients in order to ensure that the right trade-offs are made in the specification, design and development of technical solutions so that the solution of fit for purpose and cost effective     Maintain influential relationships with various streams of the development including Development teams, Project Managers and Test Team.     Major Tasks     Work with the Product Owner/Product Manager in requirements gathering and elicitation including creation of   wireframes/dashboards   in applicable scenarios     Ability to translate requirements into tasks for the development team.     Recognising issues in projects and the teams and proactively working with all parties to resolve     Own the resolution business problems     Support Development Teams with scope assessments and requirements understanding     Assist Applications Team Leader to provide technical direction to the development team     Assess identified functional requirements and non functional requirements, including business process and behaviour.     Determine impact on overall system structure and evaluate architectural trade-offs     Competencies for the Job     Customer service orientation, with emphasis on communication of ideas and architectural concepts.     Problem solving and analytical skills to provide thought leadership and to work with minimum inputs     Conversant with Agile methodology     Ability to work under pressure     Excellent teamwork skills, while preserving personal ethics and core beliefs     Experience working in agile teams and technologies     Experience working on tools(Balsamiq, Jira, etc.) is an advantage     Systems Thinking the ability to see how parts interact with the whole (big picture thinking)     Mentoring team members     Interpersonal and leadership skills servant leadership, collaboration, facilitation and negotiation     Ability to communicate with internal and external customers and all levels of management including communicating technical information to non-technical audiences     Clear and professional communication, both written and spoken     Ability to produce professional artefacts     Technical Knowledge and Experience      Essential      At least 4+ years in Business Analyst role     Worked as Business Analyst for large client facing engagements     Knowledge of Agile/Scrum processes     Knowledge of use cases and user stories     Have driven workshops with the customer team     Knowledge and experience with agile development     Clear understanding of Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology and respective experience with its application in design and development phases.     Knowledge and experience with modelling (UML)     Problem Solving experience     Strong analytical skills      Desired      Experienced in working with AI/ML projects or POCs     Has done a course or has knowledge of Business Intelligence. Data Analytics/Business Analytics     Experience working with tools for requirements capturing and tracking     You will be successful in this role if you have:    Leads a team, which performs analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, researching gaps and providing process and/or development solutions. Able to elicit requirements, identify SRs for complex product differentiating needs. Works on competency development across all functional areas. Handles multiple functional areas and mentors/coaches junior associates. Contributes to industry bodies leading the taskforces. Develops use cases for very complex requirements - involved with multiple modules. Provides training on the domain and product to team members. Demonstrates thought leadership in multiple functional areas, handle queries and competency building in respective functional area. Contributes to industry bodies being member of the taskforces. Makes recommendations to address specific business needs for technology-based solutions. Collaborates with multiple cross-functional areas externally and internally in the understanding requirements and providing direction to the development team in implementation of these. Defines system scope and objectives as well as the content of required documentation. Applies a broad range of theories, concepts, principles, and methodologies to assignments involving complex features. A seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization; resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways. Has in-depth knowledge in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines. Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions. Can manage a Team of business analysts.   Key Responsibilities   Guide the team and other Business Analysts on new business requirements.  Identify and develop use cases based on client requirements.  Verify requirements through analysis, test, demonstration and inspection.  Lead and analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures  Manage requirements through review and approval session, where project schedules, costs and duration estimates are updated and the business objectives are revisited.  Collaborate with internal and external users/customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.  Work with the test team to validate test scenarios and data.  Document and manage business and functional requirements.  Analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures  Collaborate with internal and external customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.  Participate in planning initiatives, feasibility studies, cost/benefit analyses, and new systems design.  Review user stories and acceptance criteria.  Provide thought leadership in one of the functional areas, handle queries and competency building in respective functional area.  Determine a project s requirements by extracting them from business or government policies, as well as from current and future users, through interaction and research.  Anticipate future requirements to achieve successful outcomes.  At regular intervals in the project life cycle, safeguard and protect the business and user s needs by verifying functionality, accuracy and completeness of the requirements against the original documents. Safeguarding minimizes risk by ensuring requirements are being met before investing further in system development.  Emphasize simplicity and ease of use at all times, especially in implementation.  May lead a small team of business analysts or direct activities of others on the project depending on size and scope. description: Job description   Job Description  :    Amazon is looking for a Business Analyst for the traffic team. The traffic team leads the online marketing campaigns to acquire customers online     We are looking for customer obsessed, data driven entrepreneurs to join our growing team. Solve some of the hardest problems for our customers. If you want operate at start up speed, solve some of the hardest problems and build a service which customers love, Junglee.com might just be the place for you     The Business Analyst is responsible for driving deep insights about Junglee business areas and driving continuous improvement using the analysis. The person should have a detailed understanding of a business requirement or the ability to quickly get to the root cause of a particular business issue, and draft solutions to meet requirements or resolve the root problems     Responsibilities:     Work closely with business managers and stakeholders to understand business issues and recommend solutions to ensure business questions are properly answered.     Understand trends related to Amazon business and recommend strategies to stakeholders to help drive business growth. Reporting of key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines. Respond with urgency to high priority requests from senior business leaders.     Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help shape the direction of the business.     Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Ensure data accuracy by validating data for new and existing tools. Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use.     The ideal candidate actively seeks to understand Amazon s core business values and initiatives, and translates those into everyday practices.        Qualification and Skills Required:      Basic Qualifications  :    Bachelor s degree required, MBA is preferred     2 5 years of work experience with at least 2 years of experience working in a similar role     Exposure to data mining tools like SQL ,SAS, SPSS etc     Deadline driven, team player, with strong customer focus     Outstanding analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills     Must be detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow through on issues     Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented environment with cross functional interactions. Strong analytical, mediation and problem resolution skills.     Excellent written and oral communication skills.     Attention to detail and capability to work on multiple projects in parallel     Preferred Qualifications  :    Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, dynamic pricing, demand modeling, game theory and customer/product segmentation     Experience with e-commerce, retail or marketing analytics would be an advantage.     Experience in designing and implementing custom reporting systems using automation tools  RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeMedical, Healthcare, Hospitals,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization, B.Tech/B.E. in Production/IndustrialPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsBackendData analysisC++Business AnalystSASProject managementHTMLForecastingAnalyticsSQL

description: Job description  This position is on the Access Management team in the Technology Risk Organization. The Technology Risk organization within Morgan Stanley is responsible to allow the Firm to manage its technology and data related risks through implementing proactive, comprehensive, and consistent practices across the Firm to protect franchise while capturing business opportunities.   Access management (AM) team which falls under Tech Risk organization, provides solutions that span all aspects of entitlement management, including change management during employee lifecycle events, review, provisioning, de-provisioning, auditing, reporting, adoption of applications using both in-house custom products and vendor products.      Job Responsibilities            The Entitlements Business Analyst will be responsible for developing business requirements for Business Entitlement Projects.            The primary focus will be on data entitlements (e.g. clients, accounts, and companies) which are used in fine grain entitlements.            Responsible for capturing and managing business rules for entitlements data.            Create detailed documentation covering use cases and business requirements.            Perform data analysis on large sets of complex data and provide logical representation of the data in the form of graphs and Pivot tables.            Collaborate with business partners and stakeholders to identify and define high level and detailed business/functional requirements.            Facilitate discussions with all levels and functional areas of the organization.            Provide guidance to development teams regarding functional requirements.            Partner with testing resources to identify testing requirements.            Ensure and validate that delivered functionality meets the business objectives.            Co-ordinate user acceptance testing efforts.            Prepare and deliver presentations for business units as well as senior management within the Access Management organization.            Create and maintain project documentation.            Partner with key stakeholders to translate project work into business as usual processes. description: Job description   MUST-HAVES:     Responsible for managing projects through the development lifecycle including requirements gathering, functional specifications, testing, implementation, training, transition and maintenance     Responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of a client's business needs and requirements. Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities:      Develops and improves business processes within the technology and business organizations and understands client requirements, specifying and analyzing these to a sufficient level of detail to ensure clarity of definition. Collects, writes formal specifications and communicates business requirements between development and client to design and implement business solutions.    Responsible for building and maintaining a relationship with Data Provider e.g. Exchanges, Contributors.    Responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of a client's business needs and requirements.    Participates in short term planning sessions with a client to improve a business process within an assigned client area.    Uses a structured requirement process to assess near-term needs.    Uses a structured change management process to shepherd projects from requirements gathering through design, testing, implementation, client transition and on-going systems maintenance    Provides business process and systems analysis, requirements specifications, consult on development and testing management for implementing technology-based editorial business solutions focusing on increasing productivity, data accuracy, automation and efficiency while reducing redundancy and costs.    Identify, recommend and develop methods, tools and metrics for client business process and systems operational support    Provide client systems support in order to resolve issues and contribute to on-going systems maintenance and evolution.    Identifies business priorities and advises client on options.    Responsible for generating systems documentation for operational support and end user information. Works with clients to ensure smooth transitions to new systems and/or business processes.    Develops a basic awareness and understanding of Thomson Reuters technologies, products, and services.    Recommends metrics to ensure customer satisfaction. Responsible for managing projects through the development lifecycle including requirements gathering, functional specifications, testing, implementation, training, transition and maintenance.    Works with project team members for projects of small to medium scope and simple to moderate complexity, or sub-projects within a large or highly complex project.    Accountable for the quality of own work, delivered within agreed procedures and timeframes and focused on internal and/or external customer needs.    Works independently within defined parameters, taking ownership of problems within own area of knowledge.    Decisions taken are made within guidelines set by others. Makes recommendations for process improvements to immediate manager. Receives direct guidance and supervision in day to day work.    Performs work within one business segment engaging in less complex business processes within a project context to gather and specify business requirements or to work on the next stage of the requirements process to conduct systems analysis.    Quality of work is regularly reviewed by manager to ensure it is delivered within agreed procedures and time frames and focused on internal and/or external customer needs. description: Job description    Job Description - Business Analyst             About Us:        Corra - "Great Place to Work" Certified  Organization.  Corra is the global digital agency that fashion, beauty, and lifestyle brands trust to create luxury commerce experiences. Over the past 15 years, we have built a reputation for award-winning design, disciplined execution, and innovative thinking.  With technical expertise concentrated on the Magento and Shopify Plus platforms amongst others, we produce memorable journeys that captivate customers and elevate brands to new heights.  Winner of multiple Crain's Best Places to Work Awards, we offer exciting and challenging projects with industry leading companies, competitive health benefits, flexible work arrangements, ongoing career development, company outings and tons of other bonuses.      Corra is seeking a highly motivated Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst , you will be a key member of the Technology organization and will play a critical role in the success of delivering ecommerce projects by working closely with the Solutions Strategy team. Reporting to Solution Strategy Manager, you will be working closely with the Development and QA teams to deliver functions and features based on the project requirements.     RESPONSIBILITIES        Collaborate with a Solutions Strategist and/or Client Product Owner to establish a shared vision and goals for the work product (i.e., what the project will create, for whom, and why), and ensure that it is communicated and understood by the Development team.  Create and manage a list of required features - the Product Backlog in JIRA - and ensure the stories are fully defined with both functional and non-functional requirements so that the Development & QA teams can use it to define their work.  Work alongside a Solutions Strategist to progressively decompose and refine the Product Backlog from Sprint to Sprint in response to insights about opportunities, constraints, and risks. Identify candidate stories for future sprints.  Work with Development & QA teams to ensure delivery of a work product that meets the requirements and acceptance criteria through ongoing collaboration, leading requirements definition, analysis, documentation, smoke testing the features produced to confirm that they meet the acceptance criteria, and facilitating user acceptance testing (UAT).  Create and manage supporting documentation deliverables - User Stories, Functional Specifications Document (FSD), Use Cases, Data Mapping, Workflow Diagrams and more.  Manage and prioritize multiple projects, with varying degrees of complexity and business priority, for a single client and across a portfolio of clients.       REQUIREMENTS:       Minimum 4 year's of experience as an IT Business Analyst / Product Owner / Product Manager or related title.  Undergraduate or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Technology, or a related field.  Experience of creating user stories and functional specification documents is a must.  Experience of working in agile teams that uses Scrum or Kanban as agile methodologies is a must.Certification is a plus.  Minimum 1-2 years hands-on experience with ecommerce, preferably with an ecommerce platform. We specialize in Magento Commerce and Shopify Plus. Certification is a plus.  Must have outstanding communication skills - written, verbal and listening - and be comfortable in facilitating discussions, communicating insights and presenting to internal and client stakeholders.  Experience with system integrations that are crucial to ecommerce success, such as ERP, OMS, payment services, WMS or fulfillment, CMS, CRM and more.  Experience of working in an onshore / offshore setting and working with a cross-functional team is preferred.  Experience using JIRA, Mavenlink or other Issue and Project Tracking software is preferred. description: Job description   Job Description Summary    Manages, perhaps through subordinate supervisors, the coordination of the IT activities of a section, department or functional area, with responsibility for results, including costs, methods and staffing. Receives IT assignments in the form of objectives and determines how to use IT resources to meet schedules and goals. Provides guidance to subordinates within the latitude of established company IT policies. Recommends changes to IT policies and establishes procedures that affect immediate organization(s). Works on IT issues of diverse scope where analysis of situation or data requires evaluation of a variety of factors, including an understanding of current business trends. Follows IT processes and operational policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Acts as advisor to subordinate(s) to meet schedules and/or resolve technical IT problems. Develops and administers schedules, performance requirements; mostly has budget responsibilities. Frequently interacts with subordinate supervisors, customers, and/or functional peer group managers, normally involving matters between functional areas or customers. Typically requires a Bachelor s degree with > 5 years of related experience in IT; or a Master s degree with   Key Areas of Responsibility As a Business Analyst        Collaborate with Business, IT Business Partners, Architects and Tech Leads to elaborate on the requirements. .        Build effective and productive key business stakeholder relationships (including BPO).        Early involvement in solution design and estimations.        Understands how the IT solution supports the Business Process E2E.        Analyze main business processes and requirements and translate into IT solutions.        Ensures that solution across platforms is in line with the design and development guidelines        Responsible to maximize the use and acceptance of standard/catalogue based solutions to support business needs driving industry best practices processes.        Responsible to maintain product backlog with user stories to cover development effort for the upcoming sprints.        Develop user stories/ wireframes (both functional and system operational requirements) and work with client on elaboration and ambiguity resolution.        Ongoing validation of deliverables against requirements.                    Flexibly respond to shifting business needs and priorities.        Train key users and ensure availability of training and support materials.        Prior to UAT validates that solution meets business requirements.    Experience & Knowledge:    Core technology expertise:        8 12 years of Total IT experience.        At least 8 - 10 years of relevant IT Experience.                    3 Years of full Project life - cycle Implementation experience which includes architecture, design and implementation of planning solutions using SAP BPC        Analyzes and reports on business performance by means of: Monthly performance, AOP,   product / market / customer / integral   profitability, Quarterly Forecasting, RoFo, Strategic Review, cost control,    product / market / customer / integral        Target Setting / Remuneration, Pricing/margin analysis, etc. Performs forward - looking ad - hoc analysis, such as project & strategy evaluation, benchmarking, Price/Volume mix, scenario analysis, etc.        Prepares, attends, minutes and keeps track of follow ups regarding performance and strategy meetings.        Takes initiative to bring relevant financial issues to the attention of his/her relevant stakeholders.        Participates in various x - BG/Sector/Market Finance improvement projects.        Understands systems and tools. Ensures quality, accuracy and integrity of information stored in our systems, enabling a single source of truth.    Additional Technology Skills (preferable) :        Experience integrating on premise applications with Cloud SaaS/PaaS applications        Knowledge / experience in integration with Cloud applications        Integrated Planning, SAP BW and SAP ABAP    RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - System Programming,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsBPOSAP BPCBusiness processStaffingPAASArchitectural designBusiness planningForecastingOperationsProject life cycle

description: Job description   Job Description Summary   IT Delivery is responsible for building and deploying end to end IT solutions for business and markets. This will increasingly involve configuring and integrating standard applications (the full stack including infrastructure), rather than customizing or developing software. Input for these solutions comes from the Sector/Function/Markets CIO and Platform & Architecture organizations. Upon acceptance by the business, the deliverables will be transitioned to Operations for run management. In the run phase, the Delivery organization provides 3rd line application maintenance and support to Operations.   IT Delivery applies the Agile/Scrum methodology and manages external partners on an output basis.   Competence centers and sourcing will be organized around Platforms: Idea to Market, Market to Order, Order to   Cash/Fulfillment business applications and the enabling Platforms.         Key roles in the Competence Centers are the   Competence Group Manager, Team Lead, Business Analyst, Technical Lead and Senior Project Manager.   Be an integral part of the project team translating Business Requirement into IT Solutions. Balancing out of the box solutions versus specific business requirements minimizing customizations. Understands business processes E2E (PLM and Change & Configuration Management), organization and objectives and is able to translate these into IT solutions maximizing added value.   Key areas of responsibility       Translates business requirements into user stories and Functional Requirement Specifications in accordance with approved IT Architecture.       Provides feedback on the efficiency and effectiveness of the business processes.       Supports Delivery Manager & IT BP during the pre LPC phase in evaluating the solution feasibility, solution design and high - level estimation.       Supports the Delivery Manager in validating estimations provided by partners, and timely provision of technical environments.       Develops and provides required user training for the implemented application.       Collaborate with Business, IT Business Partners, Architects and Tech Leads to elaborate on the requirements.         Understands how the IT solution supports the Business Process E2E. Has process and IT landscape expertise on Sector level, BG, Markets or Functions.       Responsible to promote out of the box functionality to the BPE and Business community.       Develop user stories/ wireframes (both functional and system operational requirements), maintain product backlog and work with client on elaboration and ambiguity resolution.    Prior to UAT validates that solution meets business requirements.         Responsible to validate test plan and functional test cases and sign off acceptance of the product       Coaches the Business Analyst and functional consultants including partners.       Promptly escalate issues, which affect product delivery and quality that are beyond scope of influence.       Responsible for Software Quality, Compliance & Regulatory aspects of the solution.       Ensure seamless business operations support (third line support) when needed.       Should have good knowledge of FDA Validation Process.       Key Competencies/Knowledge       PLM/Change & Configuration management process expert (at least 6 - 8 years relevant experience)       Expert in Windchill PDMLink, ProjectLink, MPMLink, SUMA and other modules (at least 3 years relevant experience):   o     WindChill configuration,   o     Windchill modules expertise   o     Integration of Windchill with downstream applications.       Experienced with coaching technical leads and developers.       Experienced with estimating software development.       Strong communication skills desired.       5 - 10% travel may be required       Knowledge of industry best practices to support relevant business processes.       CMII certification Desired. company: Novo Nordisk India
description: Job description Advance Business Analyst  -  SAP FICO     Information Technology & Telecom       Bangalore       Does your motivation come from challenges and working in a dynamic environment Is your ambition to create visible results Are you enthusiastic about understanding the business and bringing attention to key business challenges Then we might have the right position for you.        About the Department   Global IT organisation in Novo Nordisk consolidates all Information Technology (IT) functions anchored locally across the Novo Nordisk Executive Vice President (EVP) areas & also the IT functions driven centrally, e.g. IT infrastructure & support, Information Security and System Management of major and complex IT systems.        Finance & Legal IT Department of India leads a key role in the System Management of SAP Finance & Control, Concur & Contract Management System operating from Global IT, India. The Finance & Legal IT is responsible for operation, maintenance, support and development of these systems to support the stake holders across the globe.        The position   As an Advanced Business Analyst, you will be responsible for SAP FI system at Novo Nordisk covering maintenance and support spanning multiple countries of Novo Nordisk. You must understand the business and have technical expertise in SAP controlling in the areas such as SAP cost center accounting, SAP profit center accounting, SAP product costing, SAP profitability analysis (COPA), SAP material ledger.        Qualifications   Below qualifications are required:        MSC, MBA, BA or similar graduate degree in relevant field (Software Engineering, Economics, Computer Science)         ITIL certification or equivalent experience equivalent to Foundation level         6 - 8+ years of experience with IT         4 - 5 years of relevant technology experience         3+ years of pharmaceutical industry         Good interpersonal skills         Ability to collaborate and communicate with external parties, primarily users         Ability to represent Novo Nordisk in relations with users and external stakeholders         Excellent communication skills written and orally in English         Large degree of flexibility and the ability to work under strong time pressure        Working at Novo Nordisk  In Novo Nordisk, you will be met with trust, interesting challenges and rich opportunity for personal and professional growth. You will be investing your unique skills in an environment focused around a competent sharing of knowledge, and where your talent and experience is valued. We are proud to use our dedication and our capabilities to make a difference for millions of people around the world.        Deadline  08 May 2020.      Millions rely on us   To work for Novo Nordisk you will need the skills, dedication and ambition to change lives for the better for millions of patients living with diabetes and other chronical diseases. In exchange, we offer the chance to be part of a truly global workplace, where passion and engagement are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. description: Job description The role will support APJ (Asia pacific and Japan) sales and Sales operations leadership in developing and executing sustainable business strategies, driving team productivity improvement and managing the sales operations support Business reporting, Reporting to the Director, Business Operations APJ.   The person will closely engage and partner with cross functional team, business leaders across Sales organizations ensuring the continued success of the business units.   The core responsibility of the individual will be to provide actionable business insights to support the decision making of the businesses. For this, it is necessary to have an in-depth understanding of the Go-to-Market models, Sales cycle, as well as underlying market trends, segmentation, coverage models and The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both business analytics and operations. Ability to collaborate effectively across key stakeholders and influence/develop mutually beneficial peer relationships within VMware is also vital.   Key Responsibilities:   ? Drive proactive reporting and analysis and produce actionable business insights to facilitate effective decision-making and ensure the continued success of the business.   ? Provide Bookings, pipeline and account level insights to regional Business operations and enable them with data-based planning and segmentation decisions.   ? explore and Drive areas of automation for key KPI scorecards / dashboards in Business intelligence tools like SAP, Tableau.   ? Manage sales operations in support to the APJ Sales organization including managing forecast cadence process and driving effective pipeline management to ensure business predictability as and when needed.   ? Actively work with cross functional team such as BUs, Shared services, COEs, Enterprise data analytics team.   ? Be a trusted business partner and represent (or be a proxy for) Sales Leaders on various task forces, projects and meetings if required.   ? Manage/present business performance/KPI results in periodic business review meetings to key internal stakeholders and drive implementation of best practices across APJ.   Key Requirements:   ? 7-10 years proven experience in Sales Operations, Reporting, Business Analytics, GTM, segmentation within a fast-paced high-tech organization. Graduate / post graduate degree, MBA preferred.   ? experience in various Business intelligence tools such as Tableau, SAP BI etc.   ? Experience with the statistical modeling, financial modelling/analysis and metrics/dashboard development.   ? Highly motivated, self-starter, strategic/analytical thinker with a ?can-do? attitude, flexibility to accommodate evolving business needs and a keen eye for details.   ? Excellent and proven ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects with competing priorities.   ? Ability to deal with ambiguity and navigate through a high-paced, fast-changing and sometimes unpredictable work environment.   ? Strong communication, executive presence, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Ability to engage and influence individuals at all levels.   RoleBusiness/EDP Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaITES, BPO, KPO, LPO, Customer Service, Operations,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOperationsEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :MBA/PGDM in Marketing, Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsVMwareAutomationSales operationsBusiness analyticsAnalyticalSocial mediaBusiness strategyBusiness intelligenceFinancial modellingSAP BI

description: Job descriptionCommercial Bank: Wholesale Lending Services  Transformation & Simplification - UAT - Associate (Job Code: 601/602)   JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  JPM is comprised of four business segments, Consumer & Community Banking, Commercial Banking, Corporate & Investment Bank and Asset & Wealth Management. Wholesale Lending Services (WLS) exists within Commercial Banking and provides loan servicing functions to all four JPMorgan lines of business.     Position Overview  The Wholesale Lending Services (WLS), Transformation & Simplification Business Analyst is a senior position within the JPMorgan Chase Wholesale Lending Services leadership team. The position requires a results-focused, influential and process-disciplined leader with a strong technical acumen to deliver against an extensive future-state roadmap. description: Job description  Job Description:     Summary   Assists in the research and assessment of business goals, objectives and needs to align information technology solutions with business initiatives on small less complex accounts. Serves as the liaison between technical personnel and business area.   Essential Job Functions     Assists in planning and designing business processes; assists in formulating recommendations to improve and support business activities.   Assists in analyzing and documenting client's business requirements and processes; communicates these requirements to technical personnel by constructing basic conceptual data and process models, including data dictionaries and volume estimates.   Assists in creating basic test scenarios to be used in testing the business applications in order to verify that client requirements are incorporated into the system design.   Assists in developing and modifying systems requirements documentation to meet client needs.   Participates in meetings with clients to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions.   Executes systems test from existing test plans. Assists in analyzing testing results in all phases.   Participates in technical reviews and inspections to verify 'intent of change' is carried through phases of project.     Basic Qualifications     Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience   Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, or related field preferred   Zero or more years of business analysis experience   Experience working with the interface of information technology with functional groups within an organization   Experience working with business processes and re-engineering   Experience working with computer programming concepts and basic language     Other Qualifications     Basic interpersonal skills to interact with customers and team members   Basic communication skills   Basic analytical and problem solving skills   Basic presentation skills to communicate with management and customers   Basic personal computer and business solutions software skill   Ability to work in a team environment   Willingness to travel     Work Environment     Office environment  RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization, B.B.A / B.M.S in ManagementPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsBusiness AnalystBusiness analysisAnalyticalTest scenariosSystem designTechnology solutionsBusiness solutionsInformation technologyassociate professional

description: Job descriptionAboutJ.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB)J.P. Morgans Corporate & Investment Bank is aglobal leader across banking, markets and investor services. The worlds mostimportant corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with theirbusiness in more than 100 countries.  The Corporate & Investment Bankprovides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidityin markets around the world.PositionOverviewSales Technology is a team that supports the global Sales,Marketing and Research organization using CRM and MIS tools across theInvestment Bank.  This involves leveraging a wide range of tools that willhelp sales making decision efficiently, while collecting valuable client intelligencedata points (trade, revenue, deal, profitability, clients, contacts, etc.). The Sales Technology business analyst will drive varioustoolsets through the software development life cycle (SDLC), and build strongrelationship across all lines of business in CIB.  The position requires constant meeting timewith sales users across global business centers.  The CIB business user base is roughly 4,500 staffglobally.Responsibilities:Product manage sales toolsets throughout SDLC; collect     user requirements, work closely with UX (user experience) on design,     provide guidance to development team, and drive user adoption  Execute sales technology roadmap for Sales across Fixed     Income and Equities globally.  Partner with Sales staff and     Technology to determine the priority of the roadmap Produce requirements document that translate business     requirements into function specification for technology teams Promote CRM toolsets across CIB and drive adoption Become liaison between business users across CIB and     technology teams beyond our organization Represent technology in front of Sales staff; help     Sales navigate through different technology units as needed Represent business in front of technology teams;     articulates business use cases on behalf of Sales staff, navigate through     compliance, business management as needed Manage the priorities, deliverables, and Sales buy-in     and adoption including leading stakeholder management and communication Become in-person point of contact for Sales staff     locally to the trading floors in New York Analyze existing capabilities and identify priority     gaps and opportunities Prioritize needs and investments based upon sales and     relationship insight, competitive positioning and industry researchQualifications:Candidates must have prior experience workingwith Sales organization and developing toolsets for Sales.   Experience in the financial markets,structured problem solving with a superior academic record is required. The successful candidate should also possess the following attributes:Must have an understanding of the concepts and industry     direction for sales toolsets Strong work ethic, self-starter who is creative with a     can-do attitude  Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously and     independently, while maintaining a high degree of communication and     escalation at appropriate junctures Team player comfortable working in a fast-paced     consulting-style, unstructured environment Excellent quantitative and analytical problem solving     skills  as well as written and verbal communication Quick learner with strong attention to detail Professional maturity, personal integrity, and     excellent interpersonal skills Ability to receive and act upon feedback Experience working on a trading floor and interacting     with sales & trading is preferred High-level of proficiency in MS-Office products     (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Visio) Familiar with front-end and back-end technology     intricacy (HTML, Javascripts, .Net, WPF, Java J2EE, Oracle, Data     Warehouse, SQL)Required Candidate profilePlease see job details section for all requirementsRoleOther,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaOther,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Any Doctorate in Any Specialization, Doctorate Not RequiredKey Skillsoperationstechnologyhuman resourcesfinance

description: Job descriptionCybersecurity Technology Controls (CTC) delivers streamlined and consistent solutionssupporting JPMorgan Chases Controls, Access Management and IT Risk agendas,with a focus on stability, delivery, efficiencies and people. The goal of CTCis to drive standardization, consistency and simplicity in a JPMorgan Chasearchitecture that fosters long-term productivity, quality and innovation acrossthe entire enterprise. The disciplines within this organization areOversight & Controls Technology, Identity & Access Management, IT Risk& Controls, and Third Party Risk Management.  The Global Identity and Access Management (GIAM)organization within CTC provides access control governance and IdentityServices for all lines of business (LOBs) globally, providing theright access to the right people at the right time for all technology platformsand applications supported by CTC, and provides a comprehensive set ofapplications, tools, and staff to globally implement, monitor and managetechnology risk solutions. The Identify Governance and Administration team (IGA) withinGIAM delivers solutions to manage the lifecycle management of the accesssecurity configuration (Identity & Account Management). The primary focusbeing on standardization of the ecosystem used for managing identity and accessrequest, provisioning, certification, and reconciliation. As a Business Analyst on the IGA product teamyou will have end to end accountability for your product, from supportingthe strategy, delivery, service lifecycle and production operations. Youare expected to have subject matter expertise in all areas of businessanalysis, including backlog grooming/refinement, requirementgathering/definition, stakeholder management, communications, and userexperience.  It will be beneficial to have strong technical experience insoftware engineering. There is an implicit ownership and accountabilityfor the solution working as intended. Responsibilities: Responsibilities will include but not be limited to: Support Product Offering and Roadmap, Client     Engagement, Service Measurement and Continuous Improvement. Actively promote Agile working practices and help the     team transition from their current processes Support the Team Leads in promoting a culture of ownership,     responsibility, and quality Facilitate communication between all stakeholders to     ensure that work is prioritized appropriately to meet business objectives,     managing competing) priorities of LOBs Work with technical and non-technical stakeholders and     the team to specify epics and stories with sufficient discussion and     acceptance criteria to ensure successful delivery Organize work estimates at various levels of     granularity to set delivery expectations appropriately and allow informed     prioritization Prioritize issues and business as usual work alongside     project deliverables Update stakeholders with timely progress reports,     highlighting successes and delivery risks (and mitigation strategies     identified) Manage all team risk and security requirements,     escalating where there are gaps and delivering tactical and strategic     remediation plans Provide support for incident escalation  directing     resource and effort as required Deliver process improvement through constant review     both internally and with partner departments Partnering with the Client engagement team to provide     SME knowledge and LOB engagement as required Ensure team capacity reporting to maintain and     accommodate demand projections Departmental KPI metric tracking and reporting Identify and deliver cost saving initiativesThe ideal candidate is a results-orientedhands-on leader who can handle many different roles such as: User Centric Design Partnering with key     stakeholders to identify the solutions that meet their needs Defining user stories and     acceptance criteria Maintaining product backlog Advising stakeholders on     options, risks, and aligning of priorities Obtaining stakeholder signoff Collaborate cross functionality     with infrastructure, support, and other software engineering teams Creating user help for end     users and internal support teams Performing card (user story)     sign-off Providing direction for testing     of new functionality Facilitating implementation of     new functionality through training and demonstrations Collaborating with business     users and technology partners at all levelsQualifications: 7+ years of overall experience and 5+ years of     hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, System Analyst, or Experience in Identity & Access Management and/or     Technology Risk Management strongly preferred Results oriented; ready to challenge the status quo for     continuous improvement. Ability to develop and articulate well thought out business     case and its financial / bottom line impacts Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. High level of energy and can work under pressure with     minimal supervision Strategic thinker; makes appropriate business decisions     and gains cooperation of others. Experience producing product artifacts, including use     cases, product requirements, user journeys, high-level wire frames,     etc  Excellent verbal and written skills are critical since     this job primarily entails communicating technical information to     both technical and     non-technical audiences Strong experience with Agile development methodologies General knowledge of     financial services concepts and products Strong interpersonal skills     to manage relationships with a variety of partners and stakeholdersRequired Candidate profilePlease see job details section for all requirementsRoleOther,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaOther,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryOtherEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Any Doctorate in Any Specialization, Doctorate Not RequiredKey Skillsoperationstechnologyhuman resourcesfinance

company:
Le Logiciel is an IT solution organization that is into value added services to the education domain.  We have proved the combination of integrity; committed people and sound strategy execution always lead to a successful outcome for all stakeholders.  We do not define our purpose merely in terms of technology,  products or services,  but rather in terms of satisfied employees,  confidence of clients and delighted stakeholders.  The primary purpose of the Le Logiciel is to provide quality services and products for the education segments under ICT by which the conventional class room teaching become affordable to the common which otherwise not available to the larger section of the global education community. 

LearnSoft The nexage education technology is a quiet and simple as being the preferred organizational platform to enable discerning and highly skilled software professionals realize their full potential by working with the most cutting edge technology skills for quality conscious clients and delivering results that consistently surpass expectations.  We achieve our purpose thru a well though through and well executed strategy that helps us create distinct competitive advantages.  We strive to create congruency between our values,  our strategy,  our actions and the results.  To achieve this we have created an organization in which trust thrives.  We consider trust to be invaluable organizational asset and a leadership competency that has a positive impact on the trajectory and speed of the growth of the company. 

Strategic leadership has always been a key differentiator that has helped us achieve our organizational purpose.  Le Logiciel is one of the few small entrepreneurial organizations in the IT consulting industry to implement a systemic approach to leadership excellence.  Although our organizational purpose which is rooted in our values is a constant,  our strategy to achieve it is flexible in order to adapt to dynamic market conditions and varying demands of our clients.

description: Job description                             6-8 years of hands-on technology experience with ability to work independently and has an understanding of how a system is designed technically       Acting independently under consultative direction,  formulates,  defines,  and documents system application scope and objectives. Through research and fact-finding develops or modifies highly complex systems applications while working with development,  engineering teams and business units. Prepares detailed specifications from which system applications will be developed and maintained. Leads projects of varying scope and performs highly complex system/application analysis to ensure delivery meets business,  budgetary,  and end-user expectations.     Leads/performs the formulation,  definition,  and documentation of systems application scope and objectives working closely with systems architecture,  development,  engineering teams and business units. Works on highly complex systems applications and prepares detailed specifications from which system applications will be developed and maintained within the development lifecycle. Leads/performs key portions of the system development lifecycle including gathering,  documenting and analyzing requirements for highly complex,  multiplatform applications. Maintains documentation,  project tracking,  and key stakeholder reporting metrics. Makes recommendations for project impacts to project managers and/or systems leadership. Provides day-to-day support to existing applications and troubleshoots application performance issues as they arise. Depending on applications supported,  may provide support and guidance directly to end users. Acts as the primary liaison between key business area and systems teams,  and communicates project feasibility,  status and issues to key stakeholders. Position will have regular interaction with business leaders. Works independently,  with guidance in only the most complex situations. Reviews progress with management. Bachelor s degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent experience.     Other Preferred Qualifications: Minimum six (6) years experience. Experience with financial systems,  processing of fees or billing desired.     Normal Office Working Conditions       DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES / ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:      Work   intake/prioritization:   Work with on-shore Business Product Owners/analyst to review priorities and understand assigned deliverables. May collaborate with global design team to create user-interface mockups.   Development readiness: Work within Agile team structure to decompose and determine final "development ready" business,  technical,  and design requirements. Day-to-day support:   Acts as the daily liaison between on-shore business stakeholders and systems development teams by troubleshooting and answering questions as needed and follows up on outstanding issues that block development.   Production readiness: Support product engagement with business stakeholders as needed to ensure operational/business readiness for new features.   Performs portions of the system development lifecycle including gathering,  documenting and analyzing requirements for complex,  multi-platform applications.   Depending on applications supported,  may provide technical support and guidance directly to end users. May have regular interaction with on-shore business leaders.   Effectively leveraging tool-sets to productively facilitate the associative   requirements-to-deployment   lifecycle. company: Healthcare is an industry designed to help humans. As a global community, we continuously invest and commit to advancing human health. To deliver value and real outcomes. To rise to the challenge to find the next breakthrough by making the most of increasingly limited resources.\
description: Job description   Senior Business Systems Analyst [Data Analyst/Mapper]    The Senior Business Systems Analyst will develop and manage requirements for IQVIA RDS Reporting Analytics projects. These products have both internal and external users and form a major technical foundational component in IQVIA s overall strategy to deliver insight to its customers. The role requires collaborating cross-functionally with clinical stakeholders, clients, technology teams, and third-party vendors. The Sr. BA should have in-depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs through design reviews and elicitation sessions using a variety of proven techniques.    RESPONSIBILITIES   Performs high level and detailed requirements gathering and analysis in order to provide high quality requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community.   Responsible for overall quality of solution requirements matching to business expectations / needs.   Facilitates data requirements gathering sessions. Create prototypes and simulations to provide an accurate, graphical user interface representation of data, thereby facilitating successful solution needs definition.   Conducts data analysis activities and data prototypes against source systems, 3rd party products, or data that resides within IQVIA source solutions to confirm data quality, prove concepts, determine if data is fit for purpose and inform accurate data solutions.   Creates, manages source-to-target data maps, data profiles, data lineage, data dictionary, data design, data flow, business rules, metadata, data quality, SDLC documentation. Defines and documents data standardizations to be performed, data enrichment operations, data validations, data security requirements, and data exception handling processes. Works with metadata solutions to ensure source to report data flows are documented and auditable. Works with data modeling architects to ensure data models match data capability requirements. Works with business teams to resolve data requirement conflicts.   Triage of data issues reported by users in production systems.   Be a go to subject matter expert for IQVIA s trial and clinical data. Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes.   Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions to understand needs of the customer.   Collaborate with developers to ensure adherence to business data requirements and customer needs.   Conducts root cause analysis on data issues throughout the life cycle of the project   Follows IQVIA System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System Validation (CSV) procedures.   Model processes to clarify support needs, business data requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary.   As needed, review the Performance Qualification (PQ) document(s) prior to authorization and execution, to ensure that it incorporates previously-captured data requirements, and includes tests or test steps that explicitly address each identified data requirement.   Collaborate with Global IT Solutions functional groups by adhering to established processes to ensure that business data requirements are delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective solutions.   Collaborate with project teams to ensure timely delivery and quality of all project deliverables.   Exhibit confidence and an extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems.   Develop training and support programs for data solutions, global technology and process implementations, as needed. Continuous learning is key to success in this position.   Documents support processes, conducts continuous improvement analysis for solution performance against product SLA s, conducts overall quality analysis of production systems, supports audit processes ensuring data quality, conducts regression testing of production releases.    REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:   A motivated self-starter and technical leader with a track record producing positive results   Ability to guide the user in identifying / defining business data requirements with minimally 5 years proven experience in requirements elicitation, analysis, technical specifications, data architectures, and verification, and the ability to apply them in practice.   Minimally 5 years hand-on experience coding in SQL and SQL constructs.   Minimally 3 years hands-on experience utilizing TOAD (Tool for Oracle Application Developers) or equivalent client tool.   Minimally 3 years hands-on experience utilizing relational database solutions in the latest releases of the Oracle database is required.   Minimally 3 years experience in documenting data analysis results including source to target mapping of databases, data lineage, data profiling, data dictionaries, data quality, and more.   Minimally 2 years experience with Data Profiling concepts and processes.   Continuous learning is a natural progression for this candidate   Strong understanding of Data Warehousing / Business Intelligence principles, data usage, and database structures including data staging/lake areas, operational data stores (ODS), and data marts (DM).   Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences.   Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills.   Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature.   Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features.   Strong technical and business writing skills.   Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing.   Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC.   Ability to conceptualize and think creatively.   Ability to learn process improvement and re-engineering skills.   Ability to develop training and support programs for global technology and process implementations.    DESIRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS AND ABILITIES:   Experience in the Healthcare Industry with Life Science / Contract Research Organization (CRO) experience a strong plus.   Specific experience in CRO related solutions including CTMS, ODM, CDISC / SDTM, eDC, Safety, Lab systems is a strong plus   Experience working in a regulated Healthcare environment, a plus.   Experience in data modeling a strong plus.   Experience with near real-time, data streaming data flows, and solutions a strong plus.   Experience with Business Intelligence (BI), reporting, analytics, and/or visualization tools is highly desirable   Product development experience preferred.   Experience working with Agile methodologies, Scrum preferred.    MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:   Candidates should possess a bachelor s degree, and/or have a minimum of 5-7 years of experience and minimum of 5 years data analysis experience. Alternatively, extensive operational experience with clinical trial execution experience can be leveraged  RoleGraphic/Web Designer,Industry TypeMedical, Healthcare, Hospitals,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryProgramming & DesignEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization, B.A in Other SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsSASData modelingBusiness analysisCodingAgileScrumBusiness intelligenceSDLCIMSSQL
qualification: ['UG :Any Graduate in Any Specialization, B.A in Other Specialization', 'PG :Post Graduation Not Required']

description: Job description  Job Role And Responsibility:    Sr.Analyst, Business Value Modeling is a part of Value Engineering team who demonstrates full competence and comprehensive knowledge of justifying the value across VMware sales cycle.Value Engineering is an integral part of Strategic Pursuit Practice supporting sales teams in VMware. Reporting to Sr. Manager Value Engineering, this role will focus primarily on supporting the Value Modeling function in conjunction with Collaborative Account Planning in early sales engagements and providing account-based support from Solutions Design to Opportunity Closing.    The core responsibilities include (but not limited to) financial business case analysis, business value analysis, account research, industry benchmarking, augmentation/execution of best practices and client/partner engagements.    Ability to collaborate effectively across key stakeholders in enabling client success and influence/develop mutually beneficial peer relationships within VMware is vital.    Responsibilities  : Work directly with VMware?s internal sales organization, Business Solution Strategists, Strategic Pursuit Directors and business partners.Provide innovative customer solutions in the form of financial analysis, TCO-ROI study, business value proposals with work-around if necessary.   Out of the box thinking to create and deliver value models and messaging to VMware account team. Present to customers remotely along with the account team as the situation demands.    Ability to absorb new information readily and use it appropriately. Master new concepts quickly.Build and maintain excel models as a part of business to IT cost justification. Ensures quality and efficiency of projects/deliverables.   Communicate ideas and concepts in a clear and concise manner to the account team and stakeholders involved.   Deliver messaging on complex topics to an audience with limited functional/ financial/ technical/business knowledge.Foster open communication between individuals and teams, co-operation across departments. Work collaboratively with different businesses/groups.   Required Skills:Bachelor?s degree in Engineering is required.Around 3-6 years' experience in Sales, Pre-sales, Strategy & Consulting, Research and Analysis function within a multinational technology company (preferably cloud services and/or software industry)Presentation experience to varied persona with specialization in one or more industry verticals preferably for US and Canada regionsStrong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.    Ability to visualize and design storyboard for sales pitch by connecting research and benchmarks.Highly motivated, self-starter, strategic/analytical thinker with a "can-do" attitude, flexibility to accommodate evolving business needs and a keen eye for details.   Ability to deal with ambiguity and navigate through a high-paced, fast-changing and sometimes unpredictable work environment.English language skills preferred with strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Ability to engage and influence individuals at all levels. description: Job descriptionDear Candidate, Greetings from Aezion Inc !!! We have an excellent Opportunity for Business Analyst in Aezion Inc Bangalore. Job Location: Brigade Signature Towers, Bangalore. Job Description:- Business Analyst Goals: 1. Help businesses implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. 2. Should be multifaceted as a mediator, moderator, connector and ambassador in bringing client business needs together with IT resources. 3. Should be clear communicator, smooth facilitator, precise analyzer and team player 4. Should act like a bridge between business systems from the end user to functional implementation of technical solutions. Key Roles and Responsibilities: 1. Do the ground work before requirements gathering meeting with the client about their line of business and any sample applications etc., 2. Interact with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts in order to understand their problems and needs 3. Completely listen and jot down the key words, points and ask questions if not understood. 4. Analyze the requirements after the meeting while creating the very first version of the requirements document. 5. Identify work flows and patterns that could help with the ability for system to drive the process. 6. Pointers to follow with requirements and documenting: 1. Extract requirements: Incomplete or improper requirements lead to project failure2. Anticipate requirements: It is dynamic world of IT3. Constrain requirements: Focus on core business needs, not on users' personal preferences / trends /outdated processes.4. Organize requirements: Requirements often originates from disparate. BA must organize requirements into related categories for effective management and communication.5. Translate requirements: Sometimes, need to be translated into technical requirements or assist to the team who makes the technical requirements.6. Simplify requirements7. Verify and safeguard requirements: Continually verify the requirements and reject which are not in final business need. At regular intervals, verify functionality, accuracy and completeness of the requirements against the original initiating documents.8. System and operations maintenance: After production. Create/organize/maintain CRs, enhancements. 7. Share a clearly written document with client and get the approval. Get clarifications if needed. 8. Use AeTrack to enter all the requirements (User stories and tasks) into backlog 9. Understand the client demo timelines and plan the work for dev team accordingly. 10. Pull the user stories and necessary tasks into sprints to meet the demo deadlines. 11. Schedule meeting with Tech team and give an overview of the project and explain the next steps. Communicate with implementing team clearly and precisely. Avoid confusions and corrections after giving them the requirements to DEV team. Make sure the DEV team understood the requirement clearly. 12. Make use of testing team if available (by assigning task to testing team) OR you test the finished user stories. 13. Facilitate project activities such as client meetings, process/design workshops, user acceptance test sessions, and weekly status updates to clients / Chris / Parik / Kavitha 14. Plan deployments for internal testing / UAT/DEMO 15. Documentation of database structure and procedures 16. Responsible to validate the data issues raised by clients and internal users on the bug tracking tool and communicate the results from the validation to relevant parties 17. Perform database validation on the stored procedures developed to make sure the right output is derived for the UX mock up designed. 18. Conduct Demos'. Note down the feedback and incorporate in requirements document, communicate with tech team and to testing. The Cycle repeats and No step need to be skipped. 19. Take COMPLETE responsibility of client requirements are satisfied. Never delegate / just manage the project requirements. 20. Plan for smooth UAT after internal testing either by using testing team or by yourself. Final goal is to ensure the system is properly implemented RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - DBA, Datawarehousing,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationDoctorate :Doctorate Not RequiredKey SkillsIT Business AnalystEnterprise MobilityProduct ManagementPublishingRequirement GatheringOral CommunicationDigital Asset ManagementMedia Business AnalystMarketingGoogle AD Manager

description: Job description   Medlife's outlook towards analytics is to make it a part of  its overarching competitive strategy, and push it up to decision makers at  every level.     The Analytics Team serves data requirements and analytical modelling projects  to a diverse set of customers - from Business Teams to Supply Chain Teams to  Product Teams to Revenue Team.     Business Analyst is  expected to grasp the underlying data requirements of these teams and develop  reports/analyses that add value to them. Do you have the passion to analyse  data and impact the business materially through what you observe?  At Medlife, high focus on Impact and Ownership allows for  freedom to each to experiment and innovate. The pride is when you see the  impact of what you have created. The ability to see what your contribution does  to the business is a rare experience, add to that the fact that the impact of  it is felt by your friends and family in India - the experience is extremely  gratifying.      You're Part:    You will work as a part of the Medlife's revenue &  growth analytics team to drive business and revenue growth.   You will work as a partner to business unit executives and  drive key analytical and modelling projects relevant to the business.   You are responsible for defining, developing and  communicating key metrics and business trends to partner and management teams.   You model data in order to create reporting and dashboards  for business process management and data mining.   You execute analytical, time series, logistic models and  empower business with better optimization opportunities and customer  experience.   You lead and mentor junior Analysts.      You're Array (Nice to Haves):    Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.   Able to perform gracefully in multitasking project  environment with attention to detail.   Knowledge of predictive analytics, logistic regression and  optimization      You (Must Haves):    Bachelors in Engineering, Computer Science, Math,  Statistics, or a related discipline from a reputed institute or an MBA from a  reputed institute.   Strong quantitative abilities, distinctive problem-solving  and excellent analysis skills, predictive & statistical Modelling, Linear/  Logistic Regression.   Strong organizational, communication, presentation and  project management skills   Technical capabilities: Proficient in SQL/Mongo Db, Excel,  Other scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)   Strong working experience with BI tools (Periscope, Tableau  etc) and Statistical tools (R, SAS etc)   Strong background in statistical modelling and experience  with statistical tools such R, SASS or SPSS.
