Intel is undergoing a major transformation and as a foundation layer for this transformation, IT is implementing Oracle Cloud Product Life-cycle Management (OCPLM) As the Sr. Business Analyst (or Product Owner) your responsibilities & expectations will include:- Partnering & engaging with key stakeholders within and outside the organization, the Delivery Team, Scrum Master to build an exceptional OCPLM implementation.- Able to effectively capture stakeholder assumptions and translating them into hypothesis driven outcomes.- Help create the vision of the OCPLM roadmap through extensive knowledge of the system, business needs, business direction, users, & industry future trends of PLM.- Work within the Agile/Scrum framework, to create and prioritize features, user stories, acceptance criteria and the product backlog for each sprint.- Actively engage with the Delivery Team to collaborate, negotiate and commit to product requirements & empower them to determine work load for each sprint.- Provide clear direction and flexibility when priorities change based on user needs and requirements.- Participate in all Scrum ceremonies (e.g. backlog grooming, release & sprint planning and retrospectives) as required.- Maximize the value of the product and the work of the Delivery Team by clearly expressing Product Backlog items- Ordering the items to best achieve goals and missions- Calculating, measuring and tracking business value- Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs- Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Delivery Team will work on next- Ensuring the Delivery Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed & why it is needed.Required Candidate profileQualifications Expertise and knowledge of OCPLM solution.Experience developing partnerships with internal business customers at a senior management level & influencing direction.Strong analytical skills and ability to understand existing business processes & industry best practices.Strong leadership, management communication, and presentation skills.Bachelors of Computer Science or description: Job description   Job Description      Where you ll work     As part of a connected global team, you ll come to work in a friendly and dynamic environment. Our comfortable, cutting-edge offices contain everything you need to succeed:    Agile work spaces and hot desks  Private quiet rooms  Breakout and refreshment areas     How you ll progress:     Your development is as important to us as it is to you. You ll be rewarded for hard work here, with support to get better at what you do.  We work in a fast-paced project environment where change is constant. If you re up for the challenge, you ll have opportunities to try new things and broaden your skills quickly through exposure to the executive team and new experiences.     What you ll get:     As well as having the chance to attend regular social events, get funding for your charitable endeavours and join a range of special interest groups, you ll receive an attractive selection of benefits working with IG:    Flexible working hours and work-from home opportunities  Performance-related bonuses  Pension, insurance and medical plans  Career-focused technical and leadership training  Contribution to gym memberships and more     What you ll do:     Write, or assist in writing pitch documents/business cases.  Elicit technical requirements from stakeholders and other relevant sources through workshops, interviews and document analysis.  Define Non-Functional requirements across multiple systems.  Identify technical dependencies.  Produce high quality functional, technical and design specification documents, gap analysis, data analysis, data mapping and process modelling.  Clarify requirements as required throughout the lifecycle of a project and manage any changes.  Develop strong relationships with stakeholders in the IT functions, understanding their priorities, and effectively managing expectations.     Who you ll be:     5+ years of relevant experience working as a Business Analyst within a technical, project-driven, software and technology delivery environment  Practical experience of capturing and managing project scope and requirements.  Experienced in defining business, technical requirements and functional tests in multiple engaging ways.  Managing relationships with all levels of stakeholders.  Experience of internet technologies, front end web development technologies and messaging platforms.  Experience of IT Infrastructure platforms that support, monitor and secure critical systems.  Exceptional communication skills, both in-person and via email/phone to credibly and authoritatively represent the function in front of business and technology stakeholders.  Achievement and results-oriented.  Knowledge of solution architecture design and delivery.  Strong negotiation decision-making skills.   We re looking for tenacious, curious, eager and open-minded people to help us maintain our industry leadership. People who embody our three core values who want to champion the client, lead the way and love what we do.  We recruit based on excellence, and believe that diversity is vital to success. We have zero tolerance for bullying, harassment or any other behavior that stifles innovation and collaboration. description: Job description Not a constraint for the right candidate.     Desired Candidate Profile   The Business Systems Analyst plays a key role as subject matter expert and technical consultant throughout the lifecycle of Salesforce.com applications used by Business Units and Administrative functions across company.     Business Systems Analysts are responsible for supporting the end to end implementation of projects and solutions from analysing and documenting business and system requirements, preparing solution proposals, translating requirements into functional specifications, supporting build deliverables, planning and performing test activities, providing end-user training and creating end-user documentation, through to deployment, stabilization and steady state support.   The Business Systems Analyst will possess a unique blend of technical, business, application and people skills, have the ability to effectively prioritize work assignments, work in a team environment and will possess excellent problem-solving skills.   Experience   5-8 years   Desired Skill Set/Qualities   Possesses strong knowledge/experience in Salesforce Sales or Service business processes and use cases.    Good understanding of AppExchange products/solutions and appropriately suggest for desired use cases   Salesforce Marketing Cloud/Pardot and Integration skills are added advantage   Excellent Knowledge of Salesforce.com application (Both Sales and Service Cloud preferred) Formal Salesforce.com certifications strongly preferred   Understanding of all Salesforce Lightning lightning components and basic understanding of Salesforce Object and relationships, Apex, Visualforce Pages, Triggers, Workflows rules, Page layouts, Record Types, process builder etc.   Detail oriented ability to translate business and user requirements into detailed system requirements that are actionable by development team   Ability to influence others to achieve results through strong interpersonal skills.   Excellent organization and problem-solving skills   Clear spoken, business writing, and communication skills across global client base and teams   Strong Sense of urgency   Key Responsibilities   Document and design current and future Salesforce.com enabled solutions and drive all relevant business analysis to ensure the most effective recommendations are made for successful solution and project plan completion.    Exceptional interpersonal skills and written communication skills to frequently interact with all levels of the organization as well as global cultures; Ability to interpret technical documentation to meet business needs. Correctly identifies system / functional interdependencies.   Demonstrates ability to effectively work both independently and within cross functional project teams.Seen as a cross functional process and subject matter expert.   Accurately translating Business Requirements into detailed Salesforce.com functionality requirements. High aptitude for interpreting technical documentation as well as authoring or updating documents as needed (Functional Designs, Business Process Designs).   Ability to self-manage multiple deliverables within tight timeframes and dynamic priorities. Based on experience, can accurately estimate the cost and time to implement complex enterprise level solutions.   Extensive experience interpreting user needs and writing or editing functional specifications for new systems, systems changes and / or system enhancements; Has the ability to present ideas in a focused and concise manner. Ability to create compelling business justification for recommended direction and design.   Demonstrates leadership skills by mentoring more junior level staff and leading meetings.   Creates and executes complex test scenarios and scripts, provides training to end users and responds to critical production support requests. description:
Job description

Required experience: 

3-4 years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst in Banking industry with hands-on experience of working on Banking Software Product 

Hands-on experience in any rapid prototyping & modeling tools such as Axure & MS Visio. 

Hands-on in terms of conducting requirement workshops, conduct demos, elicit requirements, end-end requirements management, and solution design. 

Ideal candidate would be a self-starter, motivated with excellent interpersonal skills who can adapt to start-up culture and working in dynamic environment. 

Qualification: Graduation / Post graduation 

Essentials: Being a client facing roles, candidate is expected to: 

Have excellent Communication and inter personal skills and 

Strong Analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information quickly 

Domain Knowledge requirements 

Basics Banking & wealth management Concepts 

Candidate should be proficient with basic Retail, Wholesale banking & wealth management concepts 

Candidate with Prior hands-on Banking experience will be given preference 

Channel Banking / UXP concepts 

Candidate with an exposure to any channel banking product suite with a knowhow of current market trends will be preferred 

Technical Knowledge requirements ( Not must- but good to have) 

Web Application & Channel Security 

Candidates with basic understanding of Web based applications framework

Conceptual Understanding of web authentication system e.g. HID 4Tress, IBM VASCO, RSA, Siteminder etc. 

Advantage for candidate with basic understanding of standard integration mechanisms such as WebServices, IBM MQ etc. to backend host systems Advantage for candidate with an understanding of web concept such as HTML5, CSS3, JQuery etc. 

Travel Requirements: 

Role involves extensive travel. Candidates must be willing to undertake short to medium term travel on a relatively short notice, sometimes with a short gestation between assignments 

Roles and Responsibilities : 

Conduct workshops, ability to elicit, capture and analyse Client business/functional requirements and relate them to Channels banking product capability Identify any gaps/deltas together with proposals for their resolution either a workarounds or changes in processes leading to customisation , with a strong emphasis on providing a robust solution design. 

Documenting a Business Solution, clearly outlining the business requirements and proposed business solution 

Document Functional Specs, outlining as-is / to-be state of system 

Liaise with internal & external stakeholders to achieve a artefact signoff 

Liaises with development team during the course of build, test cycles

Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) if required.

Support sales cycle proposal 

Support practice building, undertake initiatives to upscale knowledge 

What You Need for this Position You should have knowledge of:

description: Job description We have an opening for a Business Analyst to be part of our company which has a fast- paced growth. The analyst will have to identify sales leads,  Strategic Account/Partner Management and pitch our machine vision solutions and products to new clients and maintain a good working relationship with new contacts. description:
Job descriptionWorks collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company s clients. Effectively manages client s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development.

Responsibilities: 

Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements. 

Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements. 

Research, identify, and specify solutions to problems. 

Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design. 

Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools. 

Support requirements management and change management processes. 

Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations. 

Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment. 

Education and Experience Required: 

Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience. 

Minimum of 2 years of related experience or a Master's degree and up to two years of experience. 

Knowledge and Skills: 

2 or more years experience. 

Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain. 

Specialized: developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - Other,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :B.Tech/B.E. in ComputersPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsSolution designChange managementBusiness AnalystBusiness analysisManager Technologybusiness rulesAnalyst IIResearchInformation technologyNew business development

description: Job description Skillset requirement:    Good Business Analysis Skillset and experience    Description   :-   - Successful candidate will be working within the Equity Risk IT team in Pune, India   - Equity Risk IT department specializes in developing and supporting front office risk platforms & solutions used by the APAC Global Markets business clusters in Asia   - Successful candidate will be supporting GIRAFFE, which is the strategic risk platform used by APAC Global Markets division.   Skills / Requirements :-   - Good understanding of financial products & risks   - Must have at-least 3+ years experience supporting front office or risk management systems, preferably for equity derivatives desks   - Experience interacting with traders, product controllers & risk managers   - Experience working on migration projects (legacy to strategic systems) will be a plus   - Understanding of ITIL (Problem management / Change management) processes   - Good analytical / problem solving skills   - Excellent oral / written communication skills   - Good understanding of different programming languages, operating systems (Windows / Linux) and environments including the ability to debug / trace issues   - Any programming experience (Java , Microsoft technologies, Perl, Python) will be a plus   - Experience working with Splunk is a definite plus   - Willing to work in shifts (morning / evening only, no night shifts) and provide weekend coverage as & when required   Key deliverables & responsibilities are :-   - Providing application support to internal users Trading, product control & risk teams   - Take ownership of, investigate, log/track and resolve 1st/2nd level support queries. This will involve an understanding of the systems supported as well as the underlying business concepts and will include root cause identification and implementing preventative solutions   - Must demonstrate the ability to analyze and understand complex problems, make sound technical decisions/recommendations, and communicate solutions in a proactive manner   - Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to articulate concepts effectively to business users and technologists at all levels   - Must be able to manage clients and their expectations in a calm and professional way in a high pressure situation   - Must be able to demonstrate a keen interest in the business line and its processes, in order to provide a good service to clients   - Should be a self-starter, motivated, with aptitude and willingness to learn   - Assess the relative severity and impact of incidents on the business and prioritize appropriately   - Manage production incidents, resolve independently or ensure appropriate ownership within support and development teams (including accurate logging/ detail gathered for reporting purposes). Ensure clients and management are kept up to date.   - Pro-actively identify areas where support queries can be reduced, and identify, document and potentially implement (small scale) solutions and encourage the global team to do this.   - Ensure that down-time in the trading environments is minimized, whilst proactively monitoring application status against service levels, addressing any issues or leading amendment discussions/ negotiations. Take a leadership role in Problem management and route cause analysis. Aim to permanently fix repeat problems rather than patch them.   - Communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing. company: Valtech is a global digital technology company where experiences are engineered.  With a focus on business transformation for over two decades,  we are continually revolutionizing how our clients connect with their consumers,  transcending the digital divide by optimizing business-critical platforms,  inventing new hardware and orchestrating omni-channel customer journeys.  We are engineers,  programmers,  UX designers,  marketers and innovators spanning 5 continents with 30+ offices throughout 14 countries  (Argentina,  Australia,  Canada,  Denmark,  France,  Germany,  India,  Luxembourg,  Netherlands,  Singapore,  Sweden,  Switzerland,  United Kingdom and USA) .  While our expertise is in technology,  marketing and experience design,  our passion is in addressing transformational business challenges for our clients.  With a strong belief that differentiation comes from orchestrating seamless experiences around the customer,  we close this gap by redesigning the customer journey and implementing the right,  fully connected solution.  With a renowned commitment to innovation and agility,  Valtech creates unprecedented success for our Global 500 clients,  such as Samsung Electronics,  Volkswagen,  Airbus,  Heineken,  Comcast and GE.  For more information,  visit www. valtech. com.  Valtech.  Where Experiences are Engineered.
description:
Job description

• Necessary

• Preferences

• Marketing

In your role as a Business Analyst,  you make the impact we have on our customers measurable.  You work for leading brands within the Valtech Digital commece practice,  and feel at home in a challenging,  international environment in which you collaborate with other experts and support them. 

What you do

Digital /  eCommercce domain knowledge

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect,  organise,  analyse,  and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Strong and innovative approach to problem solving and finding solutions

Experience in preparing Requirement documents,  Use cases,  user stories and product backlog

Flexible and proactive/ self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution

Written and verbal communication skills

Team player

Agile methodology  (Scrum preferred) 

Experienced in large eCommerce projects

Experienced in IBM WCS or Hybris or ATG or Demandware or SFCC

Requirement analysis,  clarifications and prepare requirement documents like Usecases,  userstories and product backlog. 

Supporting Business Consultant in translating business requirements to technical specifications. 

Supporting project manager in interactions with customer as required. 

Supporting Architect and Developers in improvement activities. 

Assits in collating adhoc reporting. 

Team interactions,  customer interactions and expectations management . 

Implementation of project processes and best practices. 

Adheres to policies,  guidelines and procedures of Valtech and customer while development is carried out. 

Ensure services are delivered as per SLAs. 

What we offer

You ll be a member of the international Valtech Digital commerce hub.  Here,  you and other experts form part of a growing team that works together closely to create a shared impact for some wonderful brands.  We are proud of what we do and frequently you will be pushing the limits of innovation and creativity.  We ll also support your development through our internal Academy.  So if you re looking to work for major brands on challenging projects in a culture that prizes freedom and responsibility,  get in touch.

description:
Job descriptionWorks collaboratively with clients and stakeholders -  both external and internal to the company -  to research and elicit,  analyze,  validate and document business requirements,  and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs,  correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company s clients. Effectively manages client s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals,  feasibility studies,  implementations and new business development.

•Responsibilities: 

•Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements. 

•Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups,  using strong communication skills to elicit,  document,  analyze and validate business processes,  systems,  and solution requirements. 

•Research,  identify,  and specify solutions to problems. 

•Support and conduct visualization,  user experience and configuration elements of solution design. 

•Document requirements specifications using high- maturity methods,  processes and tools. 

•Support requirements management and change management processes. 

•Support aspects of the business cycle,  including proposals,  feasibility studies,  and implementations. 

•Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment. 

•Education and Experience Required: 

•Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience. 

•Minimum of 2 years of related experience or a Master's degree and up to two years of experience. 

•Knowledge and Skills: 

•2 or more years experience. 

•Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation,  analysis,  evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high-  level information into details; abstracting low-  level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain. 

•Specialized: developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - Other,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :B.Tech/B.E. in ComputersPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsSolution designChange managementBusiness AnalystBusiness analysisManager Technologybusiness rulesAnalyst IIResearchInformation technologyNew business development

company: Novo Nordisk India
description: Job descriptionBusiness Analyst for Warehouse Management and Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals in Manufa Business Analyst for Warehouse Management and Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals in Manufa        Do you want to be part of one of the biggest, business critical programmes in Novo Nordisk, improving patient safety by ing serialisation to our packaging material and ensuring traceability in our global supply chain?             This is your chance to join Novo Nordisk, world leader in diabetes care and become part of a dynamic and global environment in the maintenance part of our IT organisation. We are looking for a SAP Logistic person with interest and experience within Warehouse Management (SAP WM) and ATTP (Advanced track and trace for Pharmaceuticals).             You will join the Manufacturing IT department India which is part of Corporate IT in Novo Nordisk that employs 200+ highly skilled IT professionals. We are part of a greater SAP community with 100+ employees, in Denmark and India, providing SAP services to the entire global organisation across the value chain. We are closely engaged with all Novo Nordisk business areas, to identify and implement optimal solutions for the business. SAP is a strategic priority in Novo Nordisk and we are working on a portfolio of activities and projects that will leverage the usage of SAP across Novo Nordisk.            You will join a team of dedicated SAP Logistics professionals and you will get the opportunity to work across both with SAP Logistics broadly and the WM module specifically.            The job entails a broad range of system management activities as we in Novo Nordisk are in the process of establishing the Novo Nordisk Corporate IT India organisation in Bangalore in the same location as Novo Nordisk India. Business travel is to be expected to coordinate and manage work with the organisation in Denmark.           Your main job task includes delivery of system support services and ensuring that business requirements are met in SAP WMHU. On GSP, you will be taking part in specifying, designing, building and testing the SAP WMATTP solution for new countries with serialisation requirements. We expect you to participate in forming the future SAP Logistics platform in an international, global company within the areas of SAP WMHU, knowledge and hands on experience in Handling Unit Management is must and integration knowledge on PP-PIQM module. You will have a high level of quality is expected from your deliverables as the project must adhere to GxP requirements, knowledge on Managed Market (MM) and Standard Deviation (SD) will advantage and knowledge on Interfaces and IDoc s.       Qualifications       The below qualifications are required.           Degree or equivalent experience in Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, Life Science or related field with +7 years experience. Pharmaceutical experience will be an advantage         IT experience covering specification, design, development, validation, implementation and maintenance of IT solutions      SAP Logistics skills, understanding and experiences in general      Preferably domain knowledge of SAP Logistics from an international pharmaceutical company     Good experience within SAP WM and HU        Team player who can work both in teams and still be able to work independently, focus on efficiency and business value in all tasks being executed, and communicate productively with clients         Ability to work with both super user and ABAP developers        Good time management and organisation skills, the ability to prioritise own work to meet tight deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of work        Experience from working in a project oriented, international matrix organisation      Excellent communication skills, comfortable working with different countries across multiple time-zones       Strong experience with support processes including use of tools and ITIL processes        Experience from working in a service level based organisation and managing service level agreements with customers and vendors           Ability to travel            The ideal candidate has a proven track record with experience of functional support or functional consulting on implementation projects within the SAP WM module. It is preferable that the candidate has strong overall business process experience. description:
Job descriptionRequired Skills:

Our client is the world's largest manufacturer of modular carpet for commercial and residential applications. Founded in 1973 the company has offices in more than 25 countries across the globe including in the USA,  Canada,  Germany,  Japan among others.

The company is looking for an experienced JD Edwards Analyst Finance based in Bangalore to assist them in implementation,  and support of JDE Financials modules (including AR,  AP,  Fin Planning,  Fixed Assets,  GL,  Expense Management,  etc).

This role required strong consulting skills,  business knowledge,  and packaged solution expertise for effective service delivery.

Primary Job Responsibilities

Defining,  analysing and reviewing customer requirements in JDE Modules

Work with the JD Edwards technical team to resolve technical issues

Configure application software to meet business requirements

Provide end- user training and support

Develop support proficiency in the GL,  AP,  AR,  FA and Cost Accounting modules

Functional testing of software upgrades and enhancements

Defining report specs and working with end- users and technical team to deliver these

Strong skills in providing process improvement aligning it with JD Edwards functionality and capability and the industry best practices

Requirements/ Skills

Bachelor s degree in computer information systems,  business administration or equivalent

5+ years of strong JD Edwards in implementation and application support application software

Expertise in the core financial modules including General Accounting,  Accounts Receivable,  Accounts Payable,  Fixed Assets,  Multi- Currency,  Job/ Project Costing,  Manufacturing Accounting,  Advanced Cost Accounting,  Job Costing,  and Expense Management.

Strong analytical and problem- solving skills and ability to interpret business requirements and produce project scope.

Experience creating detailed functional design specs from business requirements

Experience working and collaborating with Technical teams on technical specifications.

Experience working and collaborating with remote teams in high- pressure,  geographically spread,  culturally diverse,  international environments.

Experience working directly with end users

Strong business process knowledge (specific to the assigned functional area).

Understands JDE integration methodology and ability to troubleshoot issues as they arise

Excellent verbal,  written and interpersonal communication skills.

Capable of self- managing and leading a team

Compensation: Excellent salary and perks

description: Job description   Why we're hiring:    We're building a new identity platform to be rolled out globally to all 220,000 people within our organisation, revolutionising how we work together efficiently. To support this, we're building a Centre of Excellence which will be the powerhouse behind this exciting programme and ongoing service.       What you'll be doing:    As one of our IDAM Business Analysts, you'll be responsible for liaising with our global stakeholders and capturing business and technical requirements relating to the fast paced IDAM implementation programme - including the onboarding of new directories, new application integrations and strategic IDAM initiatives.       Who you'll be working with:    You'll be based out of our exciting new Bangalore Office, sharing space with an energetic team in a modern environment with great facilities. As our internal customers are globally distributed, you'll be working with our teams from all over the world.       What you'll need:     Have a fantastic and energetic can-do attitude, embracing of huge challenges  Be a great communicator, written and oral  Have good knowledge of IDAM concepts and solutions - Azure AD, AD, Okta, G-Suite  Experience of Business Analysis in the IDAM space in an Agile environment.  Experience of SSO implementations including SAML/OpenID integrations  Experience of working with global teams in large scale, high complexity environments.     Who you are:     You're open :  We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are open-minded: to new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.   You're optimistic :  We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with confidence: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.   You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we deliver extraordinary every day.      What we'll give you:     Passionate, driven people - We champion a culture of people that do extraordinary work.   Scale and opportunity - We offer the opportunity to create, influence and deliver projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.   Challenging and stimulating work - Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge? description: Job description   Why we're hiring:    WPP utilises various Cloud Service Providers, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform to provide solutions to the organisation. We are building a Cloud Centre of Excellence that will become a focal point of cloud subject matter expertise for the WPP Group  Our cloud environments are in a period of significant change and growth, with much demand for further cloud adoption. We want to ensure that requirements are accurate and well-articulated, so appropriate solutions to be developed and provisioned.       Who you'll be working with:    You'll be based in our brand-new Bangalore location. As our internal customers are globally distributed, you'll be working with our teams from all over the world, but the primary interfaces will be to Operating Company architects, the central Strategy & Architecture organisation and the Cloud Centre of Excellence.       What you'll be doing:    The role requires a strong and proven business analyst, with a solid understanding of cloud technologies and the benefits they can bring.  You will be adept at process definition, gathering business requirements and translating these into technical requirements.       What you'll need;     Strong analytic skills including the ability to interpret business needs and translate them into requirements  Experience of producing high quality documentation  Good understanding of processes relating to cloud services and ability to define new processes  Experience in working in cloud-based project environments  Experience in successful user engagement, shaping and implementing readiness activities  Able to delegate effectively and negotiate time scales with relevant teams  Experience of working with global teams in large scale, high complexity environment. description: Job description      Summary   Performs complex analyses of business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment to align information technology solutions with business initiatives for multiple, complex accounts. Serves as a subject matter expert and the liaison between technical personnel and non-technical personnel.   Essential Job Functions     Plans and designs complex business processes and system modifications. Makes recommendations to improve and support business activities.   Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques such as work sessions and interviews. Analyzes and documents client complex business requirements and processes; communicates these requirements to appropriate parties.   Creates complex test case scenarios to be used in testing; monitors/oversees the testing of business applications to verify that all client requirements are incorporated into the system design.   Provides input into developing and modifying systems to meet client needs. Develops business specifications to support these modifications.   Coordinates and facilitates meetings with clients to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions.   Coordinates business analyst tasks on information technology projects and provides project team member guidance and support. May plan, allocate and monitor work of other business analysts.   Participates in technical reviews and inspections to verify 'intent of change' is carried through the entire project.   Provides time estimates for project related tasks.   Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel. company: At Novo Nordisk, we are driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Diabetes poses one of today???s biggest global health challenges. We work for a future where fewer people get diabetes, everyone with diabetes is diagnosed, and everyone who is diagnosed receives adequate treatment and can live a life with as few limitations as possible. Since the company was founded in Denmark more than 90 years ago, we have been changing diabetes. This heritage has given us experience and capabilities that also enable us to help people defeat other serious chronic conditions: haemophilia, growth disorders and obesity. Our ambition is to take the lead in each of these areas, driving change with an unfailing belief that it can be done.
description: Job description As an SAP BO professional you are expected to possess the talent to understand complex business process end to end. You will be working independently in handling the functional support for the Information design Tool (IDT), WebI reports and dashboards, BO admin activities. You will be involved in solving incidents and analysing the backend, business logic & requirements and you are expected to have an ability to find the impact from inbound and to outbound interfaces.     Furthermore, you will be implementing changes, follow the change and release management process, and handling system corrections. You will responsible for improvements from end to end (specification, development, test, documentation, implementation, training) and monitor the health of the BO system.     In addition to the above, you are expected to understand the business setup and requirements and you will be aware of the latest upgrades in BO and roll out the BO upgrades and patches. You are expected to perform testing, regression testing. You will be participating in project and analysis activities and you will have close interaction with end-users throughout Novo Nordisk, understand business processes and be able to communicate highly complex issues in a non-technical way.     Qualifications  Below are the skills required.   The ideal candidate has a proven track record with experience of technical support with BO development and BO server administration  B.E, or BCA Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Life Science, or related field  Deep knowledge on SAP Business Objects (version 4.0 or higher) detailed knowledge and experience with all tools within the suite (WebI, AO)  Has hands on experience in BO admin activities  Very good experience with SQL database  Has experience working with GxP systems (Pharma, Banking domain etc)  5-6 years of experience with IT  3-4 years of relevant technology experiences  Ability to collaborate and communicate with external parties, primarily users  Ability to represent NN in relations with users and external stakeholders  Excellent communication skills written and orally in English  Large degree of flexibility and the ability to work under strong time pressure   The role demands you to work with HP quality centre, ServiceNow, Remedy  You will have strong experience with application management and support processes including use of tools and ITIL processes; preferred candidates have an ITIL certification and working in a project oriented, international matrix organisation  Job demands to be available for support during the Central European time business hours RoleOutside Technical Consultant,Industry TypePharma, Biotech, Clinical Research,Functional AreaIT Software - ERP, CRM,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :BCA in Computers, B.Tech/B.E. in Production/IndustrialPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsComputer scienceBusiness objectsSAPInfrastructure managementProject managementRegression testingAdobeRelease managementTechnical supportRemedy

company: At Novo Nordisk, we are driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Diabetes poses one of today???s biggest global health challenges. We work for a future where fewer people get diabetes, everyone with diabetes is diagnosed, and everyone who is diagnosed receives adequate treatment and can live a life with as few limitations as possible. description: Job description                              As an Associate Business Analyst,  we expect you to   support Commercial Effectiveness (CE) team in developing the CE assessment decks in close collaboration with various internal Novo Nordisk team and you must use strong quantitative and analytic abilities to integrate and analyse data (pharma- specific) resulting in insight generation.           Additionally,  we expect you to develop and implement mathematical models that relate sales or marketing activities to financial results and must be involved in processing various data files into useful analyses for stakeholders. Furthermore,  you will be involved to develop custom analysis tools in a variety of programming languages and applications such as Advanced Excel,  VBA,  PowerPoint,  Access & SAP system (Business Warehouse or Business Objects) and IMS databases (MIDAS).           Meanwhile,  we expect you to conduct quality check of various reports and analysis related to Commercial Effectiveness. In addition to the above,  you must prepare presentations and participate in meetings to deliver results and make recommendations and must contribute to continuous improvement of processes. Ad hoc reporting and analytical projects and active participation in CE projects will be included.           On the other hand,  you must independently execute tasksprojects with minimal supervision and must strengthen and build GSC Marketing Analytics intellectual property position and must develop operating manuals for the deliverables that have been assigned. description: Job description        About the department           General Management Global Business Services (GBS) is the central unifying department in GBS,  responsible for enabling the business of the various GBS units. It is a critical unit in GBS Bangalore,  involved in devising strategy for GBS as a whole and help in setting direction for the various GBS units based on inspiration from the global business services industry. The unit is also host to the GBS management team and is responsible for overseeing and driving strategic projects that are of a cross functional nature.            As an Associate Business Analyst your key responsibility will be to look after the Indian finance operations for Finance Department in General Management GBS,  Global Business Services (GBS) Bangalore.            Key success criteria will be to handle the bank payment verification process which involves thorough review of invoices & other supporting documents.                You are expected to handle the activities relating to credit card processing the applications,  changing the limit,  coordination with bank to resolve issues raised by employees. This also includes handling Forex Currency related transactions and co- ordination with Forex currency vendors               You are expected to maintain good relationships with banks and provide information for cash flow and fund management. You will be involved in various audit related activities & driving the local finance projects.                Hence,  a strong understanding of finance operations & internal controls being able to generate new ideas,  and maintain good collaboration with external stakeholders which includes Statutory auditors,  Tax auditors,  Tax consultants & Government Agencies and internal stakeholders which includes Department Coordinators,  GBS Management & GBS Finance          Qualifications        As a person you are ambitious,  proactive and ability to interact with people at all levels in the organisation. You hold academic bachelor s degree in commerce or equivalent with        4 to 8 years experience preferably in multinational company        You are expected to have      Knowledge of SAP Finance module (FI) is a must. They develop new environments, methodologies, processes, tools, and data governance structures to enable effective analysis and advanced modeling and statistical analysis against data sets. They also have responsibility for creating specifications for reports & analysis based on business need and recommending strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market trends. company: At Novo Nordisk, we are driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Diabetes poses one of today???s biggest global health challenges. We work for a future where fewer people get diabetes, everyone with diabetes is diagnosed, and everyone who is diagnosed receives adequate treatment and can live a life with as few limitations as possible. Since the company was founded in Denmark more than 90 years ago, we have been changing diabetes. This heritage has given us experience and capabilities that also enable us to help people defeat other serious chronic conditions: haemophilia, growth disorders and obesity. Our ambition is to take the lead in each of these areas, driving change with an unfailing belief that it can be done.
description: Job description        The position   The position holder will be part of a team of dedicated SAP Logistics professionals. They should have good insight into key IT processes, e.g. software engineering, quality management, change and release management, configuration, IT security, risk management, testing and auditing. Also need to ensure that SAP processes which are in compliance with internal and external regulatory requirements. Also you need to plan and perform various tasks, write implementation plans and reports, risk assessment, design reviews, update system documentation, installation verification, configuration control activities, test plans and reports, defect handling etc. You need to participate in system releases and expedited changes, supervise compliance and quality of vendor deliverables. You will also support system manager on the system management activities as and when required and act as liaison between the system management and quality assurance to assure that the GxP system meets the Quality Compliance requirements as per company QMS procedures and regulatory guidelines.       You will be supporting in handling system descriptions and user guides and assist the SARBOX Manager in related activities and support other SAP areas - SAP PO, SAP FI, SAP BW, SAP HR, SAP Solution manager where required. Manage deviations and practical experience in GxP areas. With this you will also develop, review or approve documentation or records as appropriate based on impact to GxP and business critical elements.       Its good to have experience in Computer System Validation, good insight into document control and records management, periodic assessments and reviews. And exposure in audits and inspections including finding solutions to compliance gaps identified in audit findings. Identify and drive process improvement initiatives. Also establish SAP compliance following up on ITSM process. Good knowledge in ITIL methodology.         Qualifications   We expect you to hold the below skills and knowledge.  MSC, MCA, MBA, BE, BTech or similar graduate degree in relevant field (Software Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration)  8+ years of experience with IT; covering specification, design, development and implementation of IT solutions  Experience within operation and maintenance of IT systems.  Exposure to pharmaceutical industry combined with general business understanding  Good interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to collaborate and communicate with various stake holders.  Good understanding of Agile framework and working in Agile teams will be an added advantage  Comfortable working in multiple time zones  Possess strong analytical skills, deadline-orientation, seek alternative solutions, self-driven, responsible, high degree of quality mind-set and involve other people to handle risks and dilemmas.  Team player who can work both in teams and still be able to work independently, focus on efficiency and business value in all tasks being executed  Good time management and organisation skills; the ability to prioritise own work to meet tight deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of work  High level of knowledge and experience with regulatory requirements (e.g. GMP, 21 CFR Part 11)     RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypePharma, Biotech, Clinical Research,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :B.Tech/B.E. in Production/Industrial, Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsComputer scienceTelecomSAPProduction planningAgileWarehouse managementRisk managementAdobeInformation technologyRelease management

company: Novo Nordisk India
description: Job description    Information Technology & Telecom       Bangalore       At Novo Nordisk we use our skills, dedication & ambition to help people with diabetes. Does your motivation come from challenges and working in a dynamic environment Is your ambition to create visible results Are you enthusiastic about understanding the business and bringing attention to key business challenges Then we might have the right position for you.    About the department   MIT is the unit which is responsible for maintaining more than 40 global IT systems at Novo Nordisk including the operation, maintenance, support and development of these systems. The systems are used on a global scale by all areas of the business from R&D to Sales and are critical to the execution of key business processes such as development, manufacturing, sales, finance, etc.       This position is in capacity of compliance responsible (ITQC) for the SAP Logistics system at Novo Nordisk.       This includes SAP logistics modules like Sales and Distribution(SD), Materials Management(MM), Advanced planner Optimiser (APO), Plant Maintenance(PM), Quality Management(QM), Production Planning and Process Industry(PPPI), Warehouse Management(WM), Advanced Track and Trace for pharmaceutical( ATTP), Global Batch Traceability (GBT) modules which are among the most critical IT systems in Novo Nordisk and they are used 24x7 by thousands of NN users worldwide.        The position   The position holder will be part of a team of dedicated SAP Logistics professionals. They should have good insight into key IT processes, e.g. software engineering, quality management, change and release management, configuration, IT security, risk management, testing and auditing. Also need to ensure that SAP processes which are in compliance with internal and external regulatory requirements. Also you need to plan and perform various tasks, write implementation plans and reports, risk assessment, design reviews, update system documentation, installation verification, configuration control activities, test plans and reports, defect handling etc. You need to participate in system releases and expedited changes, supervise compliance and quality of vendor deliverables. You will also support system manager on the system management activities as and when required and act as liaison between the system management and quality assurance to assure that the GxP system meets the Quality & Compliance requirements as per company QMS procedures and regulatory guidelines.       You will be supporting in handling system descriptions and user guides and assist the SARBOX Manager in related activities and support other SAP areas - SAP PO, SAP FI, SAP BW, SAP HR, SAP Solution manager where required. Manage deviations and practical experience in GxP areas. With this you will also develop, review or approve documentation or records as appropriate based on impact to GxP and business critical elements.       Its good to have experience in Computer System Validation, good insight into document control and records management, periodic assessments and reviews. And exposure in audits and inspections including finding solutions to compliance gaps identified in audit findings. Identify and drive process improvement initiatives. Also establish SAP compliance following up on ITSM process. Good knowledge in ITIL methodology.         Qualifications   We expect you to hold the below skills and knowledge.  MSC, MCA, MBA, BE, BTech or similar graduate degree in relevant field (Software Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration)  8+ years of experience with IT; covering specification, design, development and implementation of IT solutions  Experience within operation and maintenance of IT systems.  Exposure to pharmaceutical industry combined with general business understanding  Good interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to collaborate and communicate with various stake holders.  Good understanding of Agile framework and working in Agile teams will be an added advantage  Comfortable working in multiple time zones  Possess strong analytical skills, deadline - orientation, seek alternative solutions, self - driven, responsible, high degree of quality mind - set and involve other people to handle risks and dilemmas.  Team player who can work both in teams and still be able to work independently, focus on efficiency and business value in all tasks being executed  Good time management and organisation skills; the ability to prioritise own work to meet tight deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of work  High level of knowledge and experience with regulatory requirements (e.g. GMP, 21 CFR Part 11)     RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypePharma, Biotech, Clinical Research,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsComputer scienceTelecomSAPProduction planningAgileWarehouse managementRisk managementAdobeInformation technologyRelease management

description: Job descriptionAssociate (602/601)As a member of our Business Analysis team, you'll play acrucial role in identifying, improving and developing technology solutions thatdrive our strategic goals. You will lead a team of several technologists to plan, validate and migrate loans to our strategic loanplatform. Youre an integral part of one of the worldsbiggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprisetechnology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovationsin electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development.Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to createinnovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of everyemployee, and were building a technology organization that thrives ondiversity. company: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com.
description: Job descriptionAS  part of this the Business Analyst will be the point of contact between  Technology and Finance/PC i.e. stakeholders. Hereby the Business Analyst will  be      - interacting with counterparts in Tech, Finance and PIM      - be part of requirement gathering      - provide weekly/daily project status     - provide UAT support     - understand functional requirements and document the  requirement     - partner with PM and Production Management for their respective  project     - provide support post implementation.                          Well-rounded   experience on Investment banking (with        focus on cash accounting & derivatives)                  Should be able to own and   drive projects independently.           Well versed in Documentation and Vision desion.         Develop agendas and presentation   decks for status meetings.           Communicate to management and other key stakeholders.         Can provide feedback on project   status, offering      constructive   options to ensure project tracks to original expectations.         Direct activities, take ownership,   monitor details and      guide the   team.         Review root cause   analysis and implement best        practices.         Should have   well rounded experience in designing and        coming up with solutions.           Participating in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) phases      for defect fixes, enhancements, and   other strategic initiatives.           Can operate effectively in a dynamic environment with      tight deadlines, and can prioritize   one's own work to achieve them           Resolving phone and e-mails inquiries regarding data      quality issues, application usage, and   other miscellaneous items.           Ensuring the accurate and timely escalation and      resolution of all inquiries.         Proven ability to communicate   effectively at all levels           Excellent communication and presentation skills         Self starter and strong   motivator         Ability to identify   hot spots and quickly assess the        impact and provide tactical and strategic controls         Knowledge of SQL is desired and any   other technical      knowledge will be   added advantage.                               Our   Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and   maintain the technology that helps us safely service the worlds important   corporations, governments and institutions. Youll develop solutions for a   bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in   deposits.  CIB provides strategic   advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets   spanning over 100 countries around the world.     When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., youre not just working at a   global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds   biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+   technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology   initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in   electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development.   Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to   create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial   services industry, but also change the world.          At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee,   and were building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.  We encourage professional growth and career   development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.  If youre looking to build your career as   part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the   lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.        @2019 JPMorgan Chase & Co. company: Appario Retail Private Limited is a wholly owned subsidiary of Frontizo Business Services Private Limited (Frontizo). Frontizo is a joint venture between Patni's family and Amazon Asia Pacific Resources Private Limited. APPARIO is a seller on www.amazon.in marketplace and is currently operating in Consumer electronics categories (Wireless, consumer electronics and personal computing and Large appliances). Our vision is to be India's most customer centric company. We aspire to expand our selection in the categories we operate to every item that our customers want. We want to offer such products at the most competitive price. We intend to make these products available in such a way that these products reach the customers in the shortest possible time. We have a culture and practice of customer centricity, hiring and developing the best, insisting on the highest standards, calculated risk taking and delivering results.
description: Job description Overview: Appario Retail  Private Limited   Appario Retail Private Limited is a wholly owned  subsidiary of Frontizo Business Services Private Limited (Frontizo). Frontizo  is a joint venture between Patni's family and Amazon Asia Pacific Resources  Private Limited. APPARIO is a seller on www.amazon.in marketplace and is  currently operating in Consumer electronics categories (Wireless, consumer  electronics and personal computing and Large appliances). Our vision is to be  India's most customer centric company. We aspire to expand our selection in the  categories we operate to every item that our customers want. We want to offer  such products at the most competitive price. We intend to make these products  available in such a way that these products reach the customers in the shortest  possible time. We have a culture and practice of customer centricity, hiring  and developing the best, insisting on the highest standards, calculated risk  taking and delivering results.   Position Description: Business  Analyst  LOCATION Bangalore, India  Business  Analyst  Are you customer obsessed, flexible,  smart and analytical, strategic yet execution focused and passionate about  e-commerce? Are you an experienced, entrepreneurial leader with a strong work  ethic? If yes, this opportunity will appeal to you.   Appario Retail Private Limited is  looking for a Business Analyst.We are looking for customer obsessed,  data driven entrepreneurs to join our growing team. Solve some of the hardest  problems for our customers. If you want operate at start up speed, solve some  of the hardest problems and build a service which customers love, Appario  Retail might just be the place for you.    The Business Analyst is responsible for driving deep insights about e-commerce  business areas and driving continuous improvement using the analysis. The  person should have a detailed understanding of a business requirement or the  ability to quickly get to the root cause of a particular business issue, and  draft solutions to meet requirements or resolve the root problems.    Some of the key result areas include, but not limited to:  Work independently with business managers and       stakeholders to understand business issues and recommend solutions to       ensure business questions are properly answered Understand trends related to Appario business and       recommend strategies to stakeholders to help drive business growth.       Reporting of key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and       inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines. Respond & manage high       priority requests from senior business leaders, with urgency. Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to       uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations       that will help shape the direction of the business. Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing       metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business       decisions. Ensure data accuracy by validating data for new and existing       tools. Learn and understand a broad range of New Org's data resources and       know how, when, and which to use and which not to use.    Scale  data processes and reports; write queries that clients can update themselves;  lead work with data engineering for full-scale automation  When  needed, pull data from multiple similar sources to triangulate on fidelity  Actively  manage the timeline and deliverables of projects, focusing on interactions  within the team and solve ambiguous analyses with less well defined input to  have desired output .  Drive  to the heart of the problem and identify root causes  The ideal candidate actively seeks to understand New       Org's core business values and initiatives, and translates those into       everyday practices.  Basic  Qualifications   Bachelor's degree required, MBA is preferred  3 to 6 years years of work experience with at least 2       years in client facing roles. Proficiency in data mining tools like SQL ,SAS, SPSS       etc  Outstanding analytical, problem solving, and       organizational skills Must be detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to       self-motivate and follow through on issues  Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented       environment with cross functional interactions. Strong analytical,       mediation and problem resolution skills.  Excellent written and oral communication skills.  Attention to detail and capability to work on multiple       projects in parallel  Preferred  Qualifications   Experience with statistical analysis, regression       modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial       analysis, dynamic pricing, demand modeling, game theory and       customer/product segmentation  Experience with e-commerce, retail or marketing       analytics would be an advantage. Experience in designing and implementing custom       reporting systems using automation tools Team management experience would be preferred.  Appario is an  equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse  workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your  experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and  build. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age,  sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief. description: Job description  About the Job       This person will be in the forefront of sales metrics and analytics environment. This individual will collaborate with the Sales Operations team to support the Channels Regional VP of EMEA and Management Team.   He/She will be responsible for operationalizing our annual operating plans, including the bottoms-up development of the plan, development of a broad range of financial forecasting and business models, and the deployment of targets and quotas in conjunction with Channel Sales leadership, finance and other planning functions.    He/she will also be responsible for managing weekly and quarterly forecast reviews with the Regional VP of EMEA and Management Team.   This role requires the ability to ensure appropriate due diligence is applied to business decisions, maintaining the integrity of reported information, and synthesizing that information into a strategic asset (e.g., translate business problems to analytical deliverables for decision)   He/she will partner with other Operations and Finance teams across the company, effectively balancing mandates between Sales and other Akamai organizations, to drive business results.      Responsibilities      Planning sales target setting:     Responsible for the deployment of channel sales targets and quotas by territory   Provide analytics in the development of sales territories and deployment of Account Executives Forecast channel sales performance analysis:   Responsible for the data management, analysis and reporting of key metrics across the business to make data-driven decisions   Works to understand sales deficiencies, process bottlenecks and performance inconsistencies through reporting and analytics, and develop proactive recommendations.   Participate in Sales forecast calls, run the pipeline cadence, and manage other aspects of the business cadence.   Leverage Salesforce.com to provide analytics on deal commitments and pipeline, and post-sale reporting of bookings data and performance against plan   Partner with Akamai s Tools Reporting team to implement and leverage sales enabling platforms/tools. Monitor the sales organization s compliance with required standards for maintaining CRM data     Required Education and Experience    Applicants must meet one of the following education and experience requirements:    5 years of relevant experience and a Bachelor s degree or   3 years of relevant experience and a Master s degree     Required Skills     Bachelor s degree with 5 years of sales or channel operations experience   3 years of experience with business analytics.   5 years of Advanced Excel    3 years of PowerPoint skills required for managing/presenting data.    3 years experience with a CRM tool; preferably Salesforce.com     Desired Qualifications      Knowledge of channel sales and channel programs required.    Strong analytical and quantitative capabilities with an ability to provide data-backed analysis   Experience with business analytics tools such as Tableau strongly preferred.   Exhibit the ability to take initiative and prioritize effectively to deliver in a timely manner   Must be able to self-manage in an environment with ambiguity and constant change.   Ability to effectively communicate (verbal and written) complex topics to a broad audience, ranging from executives to functional teams.   Prior experience in the high-tech industry preferred.   A love of learning new things, building processes, evolving approaches.   Program management experience and skills preferred.  RoleAssociate/Senior Associate -(NonTechnical),Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaITES, BPO, KPO, LPO, Customer Service, Operations,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryBack Office/Web/Transaction ProcessingEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :M.A in Journalism, Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsSales operationsData managementAnalyticalChannel salesStrategic planningCustomer serviceSales processForecastingAnalyticsCRM

description: Job description Sr. Analyst works with Order  to Cash business partners within a global SAP program to align SAP Sales and  Distribution (SD) solutions with business needs. Will primarily support  the business processes associated with Order Management (standard, consignment,  third party), contract management and call offs, Supply Assignment, outbound  delivery management, pricing, returns. Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge of  this business area to identify, analyze and resolve problems on an ongoing  basis. Serves as a project team member. Directly interfaces with business  leadership (Directors/Sr. Directors) to clarify business needs, priorities, and  strategies possibly with manager's support. Will have the opportunity to  work within the most updated SAP cloud technology, build upon your SAP S4  Fashion knowledge and gain significant experience in the technological  ecosystem of a mature SAP environment.    5-7 years of  experience designing and implementing SAP Sales and Distribution (SD)    3+ years'  experience implementing SAP SD in a fashion company, either through SAP AFS,  FMS, or S4 Fashion.    Experience with  design, development and deployment of business processes associated Order  Management (standard, consignment, third party), contract management and call  offs, Supply Assignment, outbound delivery management, pricing, returns.    Good  understanding on how SAP distribution integrates with external warehouse  management systems.    At least 1 or 2  full cycle experience of ERP Transformation programs.    Ability to work  both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is  essential.    Must be able to  learn, understand, and apply new technologies to solving business problems.    Must be able to  meet deadlines of a dynamic, growing business.    Should be strong  team player who can build relationships across functions to mediate and resolve  problems    Ability to work  with senior business partners to capture detailed requirements and deliver  innovative solutions.    Understanding of  technical components required to support business processes, including  integration effort within different functional tracks. company: OverviewFounded in 1998, BCforward is one of the largest consulting firms and MBEs (Minority Business Enterprise) in the state of Indiana.  Headquartered in Indianapolis, we have offices in 42 of the contiguous states, Puerto Rico, and Hyderabad, India, we specialize in IT Recruiting, Consulting, and Staffing.Stafforward, a subsidiary of BCforward, was created in response to the growing customer demand for talent acquisition in the Administrative, Industrial, Healthcare, and Scientific fields. While BCforward continues to deliver IT staffing services to our clients, Stafforward is a dedicated subsidiary that focuses on the growing demand in these non-IT industries.The BCforward Project Management Office - PMforward - is responsible for delivering robust solutions to our clients. This division is a group managed by both our internal Project Management Organization (PMO) and technical area practice directors.BCforward will skillfully help you handle the challenges of IT Outsourcing, System Solutions, and Staffing. We can place our IT professionals inside your organization, or consult on your IT infrastructure. We are dedicated in recruiting motivated talent from the world of IT and beyond. Our commitment is to ensure that your company's business vision becomes a reality.
