description: Job description Job Description Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Provides leadership and guidance for managing full - lifecycle project implementation in NetSuite  Monitor incoming tickets and manage the allocation of those tickets to appropriate team resources  Support integration of NetSuite with other platforms, including Salesforce.com  Analyzes business needs and facilitate design, review & training sessions with technical and business stakeholders  Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating NetSuite across the organization  Manage system enhancement projects in accordance with established SDLC and agile methodologie  Create systems documentations including, business requirements documents, functional designs, user manuals, test scripts, test plans and training materials  Work collaboratively across teams and/or independently to design and build solutions on the NetSuite, SuiteScript, and SuiteBuilder platform using progressively complex capabilities including:  o Administration of new enhancements like creation of custom functions, processes, forms, reports, and workflows   o Develop reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity  o Manage security, users, roles, profiles, groups, queues and other NetSuite setup options as necessary  o Serve as a subject matter expert on items related to NetSuite and SuiteApps  o Provide support on solution requirements and recommendations  Coordinate and perform in - depth tests, including end - user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post - implementation support  Identify opportunities for automation to increase quality and speed of processes.  Prioritize tasks, manage time effectively and work on projects in parallel  Skills/Requirements Qualifications  To be considered for and to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.   Qualifications include:  Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field preferred  Track record of multiple successful NetSuite and similar ERP full - lifecycle implementation  Hands on knowledge of SuitScript 1.0/2.0   Has a professional image and builds strong relationships across functions  Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem - solving skills  Excellent written and oral communication skills while maintaining objectivity and proper understanding of a problem or situation when placed under stressful conditions  Excellent listening and interpersonal skills with ability to communicate and explain complex concepts across functions and levels of the organization  Must have the ability to make recommendation to effectively resolve problems or issues using judgement that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulation or government law  Logical and efficient  Keen attention to detail  Ability to conduct research into NetSuite issues and related products as required  Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user - friendly language  Highly self - motivated and directed and work well as with a team while learning software capabilities hands - on and willingness to be self - driven in ongoing skills development  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high - pressure environment  Strong customer service orientation  The ability to research and analyze various type of information from a variety of sources to determine best go forward path  Excellent understanding of the organization s goals and objectives  Preferred qualifications include:  Familiarity with NetSuite and/or other business applications including using business intelligence reporting tools  Familiarity with integrated application platforms and the impact of data quality on the successful transformation of information between systems  NetSuite SuiteFoundation and / or Administrator Certification   Master s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or a related discipline RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeEducation, Teaching, Training,Functional AreaIT Software - company: MOLEX (INDIA) PRIVATE LIMITED
description:
Job descriptionJob Description:
Improve systems utilization and increase value across our procurement applications. Responsibilities often come in the areas of Projects,  Enhancements,  Issue Resolution efforts. Lead implementations and provide on- going support to new Strategic Procurement Solutions (ex. SAP Ariba). Provide strategic design and hands- on efforts for continuous improvement and support of our Procurement Business related systems in SAP such as Ariba,  SPM,  SRM,  and other procurement sub- systems. Lead cross functional teams of Business and IT users in design,  support,  and execution of procurement systems and/ or process design modifications and implementations. Support application upgrades and SAP enhancement support packs for new functionality with SAP implementation methodologies. Lead projects with project management methodology and collaboration skills for high quality and effective solutions. Work with the team to create appropriate project plans for scope,  gaps,  cost,  time requirements and drive results within the schedule and budget. Participate and create functional designs for Change Management System (CMS) modifications. Create necessary functional specifications and system integration test plans and confirm integrated processes are tested and approved across applicable functional modules. Communicate with colleagues,  management and business unit(s) concerning requirements,  project status and issues with good interpersonal,  analytical,  presentation,  written and communication skills. Develop and deliver end- user training materials and training. Functional lead to support Business Decision Documents (BDD) and Business Process Procedures (BPP) for full life- cycle project implementations. Collaborate with others for Procurement related reporting and analytics. Define,  analyze,  implement new or modified reporting for procurement. Perform other related duties as assigned by senior management. 

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: 

Comprehensive knowledge of the procurement business processes such as sourcing,  contracts,  and supplier information management 

Ability to grasp business problems,  set goals,  objectives,  and provide solutions

Lead efforts to capture requirements,  functional design development and testing activities

Strong organizational,  project management and planning skills

Great interpersonal skills to work effectively with different teams within the organization to achieve common goals and respond positively to situations

Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) for clear and concise communications

Previous experience working on teams or leading project teams consisting of business and IT resources

PREFERRED: 

Knowledge of SAP Solutions

Proven project management skills that demonstrate the ability to complete assignments in a systematic and timely basis

TRAVEL: 

10- 20% Travel may be required to assist with implementations and support for projects and initiatives

Travel Required

0- 10% 

Equal Opportunity Employer

Molex is an affirmative action/ equal opportunity employer.

Number of Openings

Position : Analyst/  Associate-  HR Business Partner Solutions

Location : Bangalore (India)

Experience : 1- 8yrs

Roles and Requirements

The Business Partner Solutions team in Bangalore is responsible for providing operational support to global Business Partner teams across the talent cycle. They are also responsible for data/ system maintenance and reporting/ analytics support.

Manage the day- to- day operations of the team,  handle escalations and partner with functional teams cross- divisionally

company: CRED is an exclusive community for India's most trustworthy and creditworthy individuals, where the members are rewarded for good financial behavior. CRED was born out of a need to bring back the focus on a long lost virtue, one of trust, the idea being to create a community centered around this virtue. A community that constantly strives to become more virtuous in this regard till they finally scale their behavior to create a utopia where being trustworthy is the norm and not the exception. To build a community like this requires a community of its own; a community special in its own way, working towards making this vision come true. Here's a thought experiment: what do you get when you put a group of incredibly passionate and driven people and entrust them with the complete freedom to chase down their goals in a completely uninhibited manner? Answer: You get something close to what we have at CRED; CRED just has it better.

description: Job description"                                  About J.P. Morgan Chase & Co.                   JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available atwww.jpmorganchase.com. About J.P. Morgans Corporate & Investment Bank   J.P. Morgans Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The worlds most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.   Banking Technology supports technology for 3 parts of the Banking business under CIB (Corporate & Investment Bank), namely GIB (Global Investment Banking), GCB (Global Corporate Banking) & TS (Treasury Services). GIB works with a broad range of issuer clients, including corporations, institutions and governments, and provides comprehensive strategic advice, capital raising and risk management expertise. GCB manages the firms relationships with large corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations globally to help our clients meet their objectives and challenges in financing, risk management, working capital, cash management and investments. Treasury Services delivers cash management, trade, liquidity, commercial card and escrow services that resolve the working capital and efficiency challenges treasury professionals face today.    Be part of Banking Technology in JPMorgan:   ¢Have strong business analysis skillset able to assess and recommend on business requirements    ¢Have strong knowledge of Business Process Testing and able to work with automation team on test execution    ¢Manage the deliverables, and banker buy-in and adoption including leading stakeholder management and communication.    ¢Coordinate across numerous constituencies to gain consensus, mediate conflicts through air traffic control and develop innovative, efficient, competitive approaches to issues.    ¢Participates in all phases of the IT Project Delivery Framework, including review of complex business and functional requirements.    ¢Analyze existing capabilities and identify priority gaps and opportunities.    ¢Supporting software applications or components currently in production and/or in development in conformity with the JPMC IT Project Delivery Framework. Makes recommendations based on assessed risks to quality by applying various verification and validation techniques in coordination with the development team (QA leads, project managers, development managers, change management and QA core members).    ¢Accountable for internal process and procedure improvement projects and manages initiatives supporting continual QA process improvements and their integration with other process development activities.    ¢Assesses risk to quality service based upon results of verification and validation.    ¢Manages verification and validation activities for all production modifications.    ¢Maintains document template libraries and internal project documentation including releases, and changes.    ""¢6 - 9 yrs of Business Analysis experience.¢Excellent communication and ability to connect with business stakeholders, run demos, collate input and drive adoption of toolsets and functionalities¢Working knowledge of Jira filters and dashboards.¢Working knowledge of ALM for test planning, execution and tracking.¢Strong data analysis skills.¢Strong troubleshooting skills.¢Hands on GUI testing experience.¢Good knowledge on requirement gathering processes¢Ability to create detailed test scenarios for technical and/or business clients.¢Execute test scripts.¢Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). ¢Excellent communication, problem solving, and interpersonal skills.¢Experience working with resources in a global workforce environment is preferred.¢Excellent listening, presentation, and interpersonal skills as well as written and oral communication skills¢Understanding of different software development life cycles (Iterative, Agile, Waterfall, Iterative) and software quality assurance processes.¢Knowledge of financial services industry or similar.¢Willing to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment where daily, weekly software updates coincide with major project releases.¢Work closely with other Business Analysts and Developers for all project deliverables.¢Experienced with Complex Multi Tier financial systems and if possible Investor Services.¢Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.¢Ability to work individually and as part of a team.¢Keen attention to detail.¢Inquisitive approach not likely to take requirements and situations at face value.""Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the worlds important corporations, governments and institutions. Youll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits.  CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., youre not just working at a global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.  At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and were building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.  We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. description: Job descriptionJ.P. Morgan is a leading global financial services firm, established over 200 years ago:        o We are the leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management.       o We have assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide       o We operate in more than 100 markets.        o We have more than 243,000 employees globally.               Our wholesale businesses include J.P. Morgans Asset Management, Commercial Banking and the Corporate & Investment Bank which provide products and services to corporations, governments, municipalities, non-profits, institutions, financial intermediaries and high-net worth individuals and families.    Our corporate functions support the entire organization and include the following functions: Accounting, Audit, Finance, Human Resources, Operations, and Technology.       J.P. Morgan in India provides a comprehensive range of Corporate & Investment Banking, Commercial Banking, Asset & Wealth Management, and Corporate functions services and solutions to our clients, executing some of the most important financial transactions and providing essential strategic advice to our clients such as the government, large domestic and multi-national corporations, non-government organizations and financial institutions and investors. India is a key market for JPMorgan Chase globally and our employees in India are a critical part of how we do business globally and are integrated within our businesses. Our Corporate Service Centers are strategically positioned in Mumbai, Bangalore and Hyderabad to support the firms operations regionally and globally. The centers provide comprehensive strategic support across technology and business operations processing to all lines of business and the corporate functions.               Description   Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) serves more than 65 million consumers and 4 million small businesses with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, small business lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice.          Job Description:  This role is part of CCB Finance Planning and Analysis (P&A) and support forecasting automation related CCB & Firmwide deliverables and tasks, as well as Risk identification (Risk ID) process for CCB.  The role will be focus on tasks that related to forecast automation & optimization process flow & mapping, and support CCB material risk identification (MRI) quarterly exercise under firms Risk ID guideline and procedure.  The role will support across all Sub-LOBs within CCB (Consumer Bank, Business Banking, CWM, Auto, Student, Mortgage, and Credit Card).  The role will learn each business at a high level, and support CCB level to complete and on-going maintenance of target state forecasting process, guiding principles, and controls; as well as Risk ID process.          Key Responsibilities  Develop and maintain target state process flow and guiding principles for the Forecast Optimization ProgramMaintain Initiative tracker, issue identification & escalation, and success matrices reportingCreate executive presentations and reporting on weekly basisEnhance Controls/Risk environment & develop forecasting controls and operating proceduresOrganize and maintain Forecast optimization SOP, process mapping and control matrix centrally for CCB so it is easily accessible for future references and regulators                                     Qualifications:     Qualifications:   Bachelors' degree requiredAdvance experiences with PPT (Pitch Pro+ would be helpful), Visio,  and Excel is a plusExcellent and proven communication skills, both written and verbalExcellent prioritization skills Perform under high stress and fast paced environmentDetailed oriented, organized, process oriented & control mindsetSkilled in negotiation, problem solving and analytical reasoningShift Timings - 2pm -11pm IST . description: Job descriptionCommercial Bank: Wholesale Lending Services  Transformation & Simplification - Workflow Lead Business Analyst - Vice President (Job Code: 603) JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  JPM is comprised of four business segments, Consumer & Community Banking, Commercial Banking, Corporate & Investment Bank and Asset & Wealth Management. Wholesale Lending Services (WLS) exists within Commercial Banking and provides loan servicing functions to all four JPMorgan lines of business.   Position OverviewWithin an Agile framework, the Workflow Business Analyst Lead (Lead BA) works collaboratively with the development team and user groups to elicit, analyze, document, and validate requirements for Workflow functionality. The Lead BA handles multiple, complex project-level business engagement with users, translating business needs into technical requirements per existing processes and controls. Projects will include strategic designs and initiatives associated with the ongoing support of the application.  Responsibilities    Partner with relevant stakeholders to document requirements, working closely with technology development teams to ensure user acceptance criteria are met prior to implementation   Act as the primary interface between the Product Owner and the Feature Team for the assigned domain  Establish working relationships and routinely interface with: project sponsors, business stakeholders, technology, Subject Matter Experts (SMES), and other functional partners to provide/complete required project documentation (process flows, gap analysis, procedures, etc.)  Represent the user group by presenting document requirements to the technology teams, Gather stakeholder input and signoff as required  Contribute to the end to end business design of the workflow applications, thinking strategically across various user groups  Oversee the testing teams understanding of requirements and test functionality as needed  Assist with Governance of new requests by leading discussions for inclusion in Product Backlog  Develops others in increasing levels of business and technical acumen in order to effectively bridge the gap between business and technology  Establish and facilitate appropriate regular working meetings as required, develop presentations and shape messages in a manner effective for senior management and business presentation  Gather stakeholder input and signoff as required  Provide timeline estimates to project plans as needed  Monitor, track, and report on owned project deliverables through each stage of the project life cycle  Identify and track risks and issues, and escalate as needed to management  Provide user support during production incidents and proactively communicate status    Skills and Qualifications   Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required   A minimum of 5 years in the financial services market  Experience in leading the elicitation and documentation of workflows and business requirements  Experience in loan operations and/or loan technology preferred  Agile/Scrum project management methodology experience is a plus  Able to operate independently, follow tight deadlines, and prioritize work in order to support concurrent projects  Strong analytical, communication (verbal and written), and delivery skills   Adept at working with a diverse group of stakeholders; tailoring communication styles and methods as needed  Able to understand big picture concepts and break them down into detail needed to implement them.  Participates proactively and continuously in the activities of the team. description: Job descriptionA Senior business analyst is required with extensive  experience in development of supply chain management software specially with  manufacturing, inventory and logistics modules.   Senior technical business analyst will manage the functional  aspects of the development of a supply chain software.   Requirements:    Bachelor's  degree in computers or related field or equivalent experience.   4+  years' configuration experience in a minimum of two SAP logistic modules or any  logistics solution   Must  possess sound SAP functional knowledge in Supply Chain areas (Planning,  Procurement, Manufacturing, Logistics, etc.) including master data and  integration with related areas (i.e. upstream and downstream processes)   Significant  experience in Materials Management (MM), Logistic Execution (LE), and Supplier  Relationship Management (SRM)    SAP  rollout experience (>2 lifecycles)   Demonstrable  experience of SAP Deployments, Process Governance and Continuous Improvement   Founded  understanding of Project Management and a PM methodology   Demonstrable  experience understanding both functional and technical solutions, including  writing user stories for a logistics supply chain software    3+  Years of experience in a business environment performing analysis, requirements  gathering, and problem-solving  Main Responsibilities o  Establish  close relationships with product owners in order to discover and translate  requirements including functional and non-functional o Agile  learner to become a trusted subject matter expert and explorer in business  domains and capabilities assigned o Demonstrate  the ability to be self-directing within the construct of a team in order to  accomplish project objectives o Enjoy  working with business partners and internal teams to brainstorm solutions, help  identify and evaluate pros and cons, and then to guide decision-making through  analysis techniques o Exhibit  curiosity and a willingness to ask questions in order to understand the  "why" o Identify  issues and risks and proactively communicate them to the project manager/scrum  master o  Experienced with defining what is in scope and out of scope, and making sure  project artifacts represent that scope, and are understood by the project team  members o Able to  achieve proper requirements definition regardless of project methodology or  framework o  Recognize the value of clear, complete acceptance criteria in user stories;  committed to making sure the solution meets all acceptance criteria o Value  the importance of change management; able to discern the perspective of the  end-users and recommend change management approaches to address those  perspectives o  Appreciate the value in creating and maintaining proper documentation that will  be valuable to ongoing platform management activities after the specific  project effort has completed. description: Job description   We are looking to expand our Vendor Solutions capability to include WallStreet thought leadership and delivery as a capability. Clients come to us for SME knowledge across trading architectures,   system selection,   best practice project methodologies delivered in partnership with the vendors and Excelian's own products to accelerate project delivery.   We offer our staff an interesting career with a huge emphasis on both learning and real delivery. Opportunities are readily available for those looking to extend their technical or business knowledge,   gain commercial involvement in consultancy,   lead client relationships and manage delivery teams.   We are the best at what we do and want to find business technology consultants to help us continue to grow and make a difference to our market and clients.   Our client (a major Australian bank) has a well- established vendor platform managing their trading businesses and they are looking for Senior Functional testers to join their FX Enhancements team. This role will require a self- starter test lead with experience of test automation who can also lead automation work along with Functional testing. Our client is looking for a T shape professional who is able to also able to function as a BA,   this is a multi- disciplinary role. As this role is deeply engrained into the client FX system it will require a tester with markets and ideally FX experience       Responsibilities   Static Test reviews (of Business Requirement,   Functional Specification documents)  Planning and scheduling of test phases for projects as detailed within the Test Strategy  Development of test conditions and test cases for phase level test  Requirements for test data  Recording of test metrics  Phase level test execution  Defect management  Status reporting     Skills   Must have    Test management of complex IB projects including Legal Entity restructuring; trade lifecycle testing; Exchange and OTC product testing.  Good understanding of downstream trade processes (settlementconfirmations)  Good understanding of front office FX trade origination and risk management(Good to have WallstreetMurex experience)  Strong testing process knowledge  o Identifying test cases from requirements,   ensuring testability of requirements  o Able to write acceptance criteria in gherkin format (optional)  o Good understanding of defect management process  Basic SQL skills  XML test tool experience such as UFT,   ALM,   Jira and Adaptavist  Tools: test automation tools and integrations such as Selenium,   Cucumber,   Jenkins (desirable)  Basic Java and CICD Integration understanding & hands- on.  Experience working in Agile environment.  General: demonstrated testing ability,   translating user stories to test cases. Following a process to identify test scenarios,   prioritise these and drill down to test cases. Work with developers,   raise defects,   test releases. Understand what can be automated,   what should be prioritised for automation and preferably,   implement the automation.    Nice to have    Good Communication,   Inter personal skills                  RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeRecruitment, Staffing,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategorySystem Design/Implementation/ERP/CRMEducationUG :B.A in Other SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsBusiness analysisXMLFunctional testingConsultingAgileSeleniumTest casesRisk managementInformation technologySQL

description:
Job descriptionPosition: ASSOCIATE ANALYST

Experience: 0-2 years

Job Location: Bangalore

Qualification: Graduate in any discipline with good academic record. Graduates preferably from B.Com,  BBM,  BBA,  BCA,  B.Sc. Maths and Statistics education background.

About E2open:

Founded in 2000,  E2open provides the largest and most comprehensive Supply Chain Operating Network,  including a broad suite of collaborative supply chain solutions. Leading global enterprises rely on E2open to provide greater end-to-end visibility,  more accurate data and insights,  and real-time business process orchestration across complex,  multi-enterprise trading partner networks.

Businesses recognize that effective supply chain operations are the key to sustainable competitive advantage and shareholder value. E2open works with the world s largest manufacturers and brand owners across a variety of industries to deliver a highly responsive,  integrated network of partners,  based on accurate,  actionable information.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Execute Zyme channel visibility services for clients. Collect,  consolidate,  and analyze client point of sale and inventory information.

Execute production process according to process documentation,  quality assurance procedures to ensure sustainable,  high quality deliverables.

Develop strong understanding of Zyme internal tools and technology used to optimize data consolidation and reconciliation services

Recommend ways to improve process,  documentation,  internal tools and technology to make daily work flow stable and error-free.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

Comfortable with computers,  technology and utilizing software (Microsoft Excel,  Access,  other) to perform business analysis.

Intellectual curiosity,  detail orientation and desire to analyze and investigate trends/ patterns in data and information.

COMMUNICATION

Strong verbal and written communications skills,  especially the ability to organize and articulate a well-structured argument.

Strong personal interest in constantly improving communications skills and styles.

OTHER

Knowledge of Statistical Process Control techniques & concepts Education is an added advantage

description: Job description  About the Role     The role is for Financial Controls Oversight Senior   Consultant - Data Analytics Services      Responsibilities     As a component of the Enterprise COSO testing team, the IT COSO team supports the Company s on-going objective of maintaining an industry-leading information technology control environment and is responsible for the following directives:    Providing meaningful assessments of IT control environments impacted by financial, risk, and regulatory reporting;    Assessing adherence to Well Fargo Company s COSO based policies for IT controls impacted by internal controls over financial reporting (SEC and Regulatory Reporting) and strategic planning for on-going IT control adherence to COSO policies (proactive anticipation of internal control related matters);    Monitoring new and emerging internal control related guidance and issues and assist with facilitating group-wide training to interested and impacted stakeholders;    Providing consultation and subject matter expertise for process and IT control related matters including evaluating severity of control deficiencies and related remediation efforts;    Providing process and control support and thought leadership for projects;    Interfacing with external auditors, regulators and others on control related matters; and,    Acting as a change agent for continual improvement of the control environment.    This individual will be responsible for supporting the following team directives:     Leading projects/initiatives with high risk and complexity impacting the broader team    Facilitating the identification of opportunities to utilize data analysis in the assessment of risk and controls.    Performing business analysis, project management, design and solution testing of analytics in adherence to our development methodology.    Partnering with ECO teams to ensure data analytic needs are met such as continuous auditing activities, robotics, special projects, substantive testing support, etc.    Training and mentoring the team in the use of data analysis techniques and tools    Navigating within technology environments to locate, validate, extract, and format data for data analysis    Analyzing complex data and providing the analytic results in a user-friendly format    Developing and maintaining program scripts used for data analysis, controls automation and controls testing.    Providing recommendations on types of analytics and procedures used to meet control testing objectives    Communicating data analysis conclusions to management.    Ensuing accuracy and completeness of analytic results.    Building relationships and collaborating with key stakeholders related to assigned areas   RoleFinancial Accountant,Industry TypeBanking, Financial Services, Broking,Functional AreaAccounts, Finance, Tax, Company Secretary, Audit,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryAccountsEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsData analysisAutomationFinancial reportingBusiness analysisProject managementStrategic planningData analyticsInformation technologyAnalyticsMonitoring

company: At Novo Nordisk, we are driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Diabetes poses one of today??s biggest global health challenges. We work for a future where fewer people get diabetes, everyone with diabetes is diagnosed, and everyone who is diagnosed receives adequate treatment and can live a life with as few limitations as possible. Since the company was founded in Denmark more than 90 years ago, we have been changing diabetes. This heritage has given us experience and capabilities that also enable us to help people defeat other serious chronic conditions: haemophilia, growth disorders and obesity. Our ambition is to take the lead in each of these areas, driving change with an unfailing belief that it can be done.

company: As the world's leader in digital payments technology,  Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative,  reliable and secure payment network -  enabling individuals,  businesses,  and economies to thrive.  Our advanced global processing network,  VisaNet,  provides secure and reliable payments around the world,  and is capable of handling more than 65, 000 transaction messages a second.  The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device,  and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone,  everywhere.  As the world moves from analog to digital,  Visa is applying our brand,  products,  people,  network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.  At Visa,  your individuality fits right in.  Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world,  invest in your career growth,  and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace.  We are a global team of disruptors,  trailblazers,  innovators and risk- takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world,  creatively moving the industry forward,  and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.   You're an Individual.  We're the team for you.  Together,  let's transform the way the world pays.
description: Job description Job Description    Open VisaNet (OVN), is the Next Generation VisaNet. OVN will use best-in-class technology components to push the envelope as a highly scalable, secure, cost-effective and distributed application on commodity hardware. Open VisaNet (OVN) is one of Visa's Key initiatives which will help Visa support in-country and global processing solutions while providing Visa an opportunity to move away from proprietary hardware systems. Realizing the vision of OVN requires the collaboration of an exceptional group of software engineers, security specialists, DevOps engineers, payment experts, infrastructure architects and business analysts. To support our development roadmap, we are creating a function to ramp up the creation and delivery of business requirements which articulate the current VisaNet business logic, both functional and non-functional. Reporting to the Sr. Director of Technical Requirements and Business Analysis, this role in Bangalore will be accountable for generation and publication of business requirements for more than 330 discrete services and functions.    Qualifications     Essential Functions     Define and document detailed functional and non-functional (performance and operational) requirements for OVN  .      Work with Architecture and Development teams to refine and maintain templates for the requirements artifacts that will be produced by the team.     Work with Architecture and Development teams to ensure detailed requirements are accurate, complete and can be understood by a diverse group of users.     Collaborate with the quality assurance team on creation of testing artifacts.     Manage the lifecycle of requirement artifacts to elaborate requirements of OVN as needed.     In addition to the responsibilities for requirements elaboration, the candidate will perform the role of a Product Owner on an assigned sprint team as needed.     Acquire a good understanding of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) concepts and play an active role in SAFe activities as required for the Product Owner role.     Participate in Team Demos and Retrospectives     Basic Qualifications:     Demonstrated experience with producing high quality requirements, documentation and user stories  .      Team player with experience collaborating with Subject Matter Experts, system architects and senior software engineers.     Ability to work with multicultural teams across the globe.     Ability to work across time zones as required.     Strong knowledge of MS-Office products for Windows including Word, Excel, Visio, and SharePoint and Wiki.     Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities with periodic direction from management.     Strong analytical, research, interpersonal and problem-solving skills     Capable of forming and advocating for an independent viewpoint.     Demonstrated skills in influencing, negotiating and communicating.     6+ year track record of relevant work experience and an undergraduate degree in Information Systems, English, Journalism, Communications, or a related technology focused field. Master's degree is a plus.      Preferred Qualifications      Knowledgeable about Visa systems or applications.     Some knowledge of the payment business as well as products and services provided by VisaNet.  RoleSystem Analyst,Industry TypeIT-Software, Software Services,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryProgramming & DesignEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Any Postgraduate in Any SpecializationKey SkillsManager Quality AssuranceArchitectureBusiness analysisAnalytical researchAgileManager TechnologyWindowsVisioMS OfficeOperations

description: Job description Specialist  Business Operations  Role Overview Looking for energized candidate with 0 to 2 years of experience in the Business Intelligence field. As a Business Intelligence Support Team Member, you will be responsible for day-to-day support, monitoring and trouble shooting of non-production and production of BI reporting applications. You will work closely with Business, Infrastructure, Support and Delivery Teams to analyze and provide resolutions in a complex environment.   Role Responsibilities  * Support, Monitor, Maintain, Trouble Shoot and Optimize the BI Applications pertaining to PAG GBS Domain. Provide day-to-day operational support * Work with Business, Delivery and Support teams to analyze production issues in a critical, high pressure situation. * Provide thought leadership, advice and guidance in your field of expertise * Provide inputs in setting governance and standards related to all aspects of BI environment * Work with the Team to analyze database operational data, identify potential issues and proactively initiate resolution strategies with other application and IT support team * Participate in on-call rotation as needed * Participate in and contribute to the implementation of best industry practices * Contribute to architecture and capacity planning activities * Conduct performance tuning and capacity management * Perform root cause analysis on failed components and implement corrective measures. * Provide ongoing information to leadership, customers, and peers regarding enhancements, innovations and solutions. * Responsible for following company specific systems engineering standards.   Requirements  -A minimum of 0-2 years experience in any BI platforms - Tableau, PowerBI, BOBJ, TOLAP and exposure to .NET framework -Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, Teradata, Hadoop etc  -Experience with PowerBI is a must  -A solid understanding of MS SQL DBMS and T-SQL  -A solid understanding of Dimensional Modelling and Data Warehouse Design. -Experience with .NET programming a plus -Exposure to the MDX query language -Knowledge of Sharepoint (Business Intelligence) is a plus. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. Lead the FCSU to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Operation of Financial Markets; Financial Crime Prevention; The Right Environment. People and talent     Promote and embed a culture of openness, trust and risk awareness, where ethical, legal, regulatory and policy compliant conduct is the norm. company: Lendingkart is one of the leading fintech firms in the Indian lending space, which is expected to cross $1 trillion by 2020. It raised the largest round in Indian digital lending ($87 million in Series C) earlier this year. It is backed by top-tier investors - Temasek (through its 100% subsidiary Fullerton Financial Services), Bertelsmann (Pepperfry, Saavn, Udacity, Treebo), Mayfield Fund (Simplilearn, Indiaproperty.com, Knowlarity, Bharatmatrimony.com), India Quotient (IIMjobs, Roposo, Prettysecrets) and Saama Capital (Snapdeal, Chai point, Paytm, Tutor Vista) to name a few.We are No.1 in India in Lending space and the only lending company from India to be featured in the Top 50 most established fintech firms acclaimed in annual' 'Fintech100' report by KPMG, where they have uncovered the most innovative Fintech companies globally.We operate as a digital lending platform that facilitates working capital financing for entrepreneurs and small businesses in India through our network of affiliated lending partners. We have developed a technology platform powered by machine learning algorithms which use big data to help its affiliate lenders evaluate borrower's credit worthiness. Customers can apply for a loan using the web or mobile applications at their convenience and receive their sanctioned loans in as less as 1-3 days anywhere in the country.

Participate in and often lead a Development team that is responsible for developing quality software.

Strong understanding of various development processes (SCRUM, Agile, RAD, etc), including specification, documentation and quality assurance 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Education (minimum requirements/equivalent): 
BA/BS or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent industry experience

involvement with,  and agreement from, the user community  Produce and review data/information models and preliminary  system architecture, as needed  Create prototypes and simulations to provide an accurate,  graphical user interface representation, thereby facilitating successful  solution design and development  Evaluate and communicate departmental strategy to IT and  business staff  Resolve conflicting end-user requirements  Follow IQVIA System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System  Validation (CSV) procedures, as appropriate  Collaborate with the Lead User, or delegated member of the  applicable business group, to create a User Requirements Specification (URS)  document  Collaborate with the Development group to create a  Functional Specification (FS) document  Model processes to clarify business requirements, and to  enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with,  solution design and implementation, as necessary  Maintain knowledge of the IT industry; analyze the  abilities of tools and technologies, compare with the need of the business,  then recommend potential solutions to managers within the business  As needed, review SLC Development and Validation  document(s) prior to authorization to ensure that it incorporates  previously-captured requirements, and includes tests or test steps that  explicitly address each identified user requirement  Collaborate with Global IT Solutions functional groups by  adhering to established processes to ensure that business requirements are  delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective  solutions  Collaborate with developers to ensure adherence to business  requirements and UI design specifications  Develop training and support programs for global  technology and process implementations, as needed   Coach/mentor staff and provide technical leadership, as  needed   Other job duties as requested     REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES description: Job description    Commercial Business Management ¢¢¢ Sales Planning & Strategy Sr. Advisor        Job Title:     Commercial Business Management - Sales Planning & Strategy Sr. Advisor       This person will be a part of the team supporting the Global Go-to-Market (GTM) Insights and Analytics team for Commercial. The goal of this team is identifying, defining, analyzing and recommending potential new growth strategies for Dell's Commercial Business. Also, supporting strategic and operational projects from ideation through execution.    The person will be responsible for using robust data analytics skills and work with internal stakeholders and external partners to evaluate customer segments, Go-To-Market & Route-To-Market models, and build specific actionable recommendations to improve Dell's GTM. The candidate will have hands-on analytics capabilities and expertise in problem-solving techniques. company: Vimta Labs Limited is engaged in the business of contract research and testing services. The Company provides services of testing and contract research in the fields of clinical and pre-clinical studies, clinical reference, analytical testing, advanced molecular biology and environmental studies. It supports regulatory authorities in mandatory certification of food and agricultural products exported from India. It assists the food industry for nutritional labelling, food safety evaluations, trace analysis and shelf life studies. Its environmental services include site selection and liability studies; environmental impact assessments; environment management plans, and carrying capacity-based regional studies. It also offers deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequencing, MassArray services and MicroArray services. It also offers inspection services, such as pre-shipment inspection services; quantity inspection and sampling; container stuffing and sealing, and inspection during production.

description: Job description Role Responsibilities:    Support Cybersecurity risk protection across Cloud (AWS) and BI Analytics (Oracle) platform   Provide digital risk management consultancy on projects, secure code development and security architecture   Lead and automate continuous assurance in digital risk assessment, remediation and auditin   Assist DDH Digital Risk Leader in practice and global group:   Data security and resilience strategy, policy design and enforcement   Secure programming, DevSecOps and data privacy   Data breach investigation, response and recovery   Inspire innovation, agility and learning every day to better protect Schneider Electric.   Role seeks a 0-4 years experience security professional (or strong programmer looking for a career change into Cybersecurity). AWS or Azure experience is a bonus.    All canidates must have strong code writing skills and be comfortable delivering hands-on security in a multi-national, cross-timezone, Big Data environment.   Structured 2 year security on-the-job training and professional mentoring as part of the role.     Qualifications     Candidate expected to have a university degree in Science, Technology or Engineering in a Programming or Security specialization.   Strong, demonstrable passion for applied security and innovation.   Basic knowledge of Cybersecurity and digital risk management.    Minimum 1 year hands on demonstrable code development experience in any programming language.     Professional Experience and Competences     IT configuration AWS, Oracle, Web Server technologies.   Security controls focusing on NIST 800, Cloud AWS / Oracle Security.   Hands on experience programming (e.g. SQL, Java, .NET, Python, R.)     Soft Skills      Customer first, Innovation Oriented ways of working (flexible, personable, approachable, creative, bias-to-action and pragmatic).   Strong communications, multi-tasking and problem-solving skills.   Excellent ability to work in a highly matrix organization with strong collaboration and conflict management skills for cross-country/timezone projects and teamwork.   Comfortable to accept frequent re-prioritization of responsibilities and role mandate. Change in accordance with business requirements in an AGILE organisation undergoing multi-speed digital transformation.   Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate tasks into actionable designs and simple to follow procedure steps for non-technical customers and users.   Ability to work under tight deadlines and self-prioritize responsibilities.   Proven ability to handle and maintain confidential information. company: Bioclinica Inc Privacy Policy    Clinical trials are complex and monolithic approaches are the norm. But the most successful trials require the ability to see key details and uncover hidden insights. Bioclinica is specifically structured to create clarity in the clinical trial process so you can make better decisions. Bioclinica is divided into three business segments to deliver focused service supporting multifaceted technologies. The Medical Imaging and Biomarkers segment provides medical imaging and cardiac safety services and includes a molecular marker laboratory. The eHealth Solutions segment comprises an eClinical technology platform and professional services along with safety and regulatory solutions. Under the Global Clinical Research segment, Bioclinica offers a network of research sites, patient recruitment-retention services, and a post-approval research division. The company serves more than 400 pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and device organizations - including all of the top 20 - through a network of offices in the U.S., Europe and Asia
description: Job description Recognize,  exemplify and adhere to BIOCLINICA's values which center around our commitment to People,  Clients and Performance.  As a member of staff,  the employee is expected to embrace and contribute to our culture of process improvement with a focus on streamlining our processes adding value to our business and meeting client needs  Ability to understand SCS (Software Configuration Spec) thoroughly and configure the Clinical Imaging System as required  Ability to understand SCS (Software Configuration Spec) thoroughly and write Validation rules / Derivation rules as required  Ensure every piece of code is UNIT TESTED thoroughly before it goes to SQA Validation.  Ensure to achieve FTQ (First Time Quality) result in all deliverables  Ensure every Project meets the Timeline  Provide Technical Support to Juniors and guide them as required  Train and Mentor any new associates within the Config group  Keep Project team / Manager (Onshore/Offshore) informed of project status in relation to quality and timelines  Ability to thoroughly review SCS and/or user requirements and understand,  including the complex forms,  functions,  rules in it.  Assist / teach other Developers/Programmers with tasks as needed including Configuration,  Rules writing,  Unit testing and anything else as required to complete the Config Project  Ability to complete projects and other tasks efficiently within the allocated timelines with little or no supervision.  Develop/Maintain good working relationship with other close groups like Validation and Medical Writing.  Develop/Maintain User Manuals,  Knowledge Library and TIP sheets for all applications / projects that are involved. E.g. Study Direct tool  Develop/maintain function wide programming Checklists/guidelines as needed,  to improve efficiency and promote quality and consistency  Secondary Responsibilities   Ability to work independently with minimal supervision  Ability to work on Multiple projects,  and support the Technical Lead in performing technical research,  identify and propose viable technical solutions  Ability to determine and make improvements to current processes and applications. Bring about new process- oriented initiatives and implement them successfully  Participate in interviewing and hiring decisions regarding candidates  Maintain confidentiality of management information as appropriate  Actively participate in Internal and External Audits  Participate in Annual Appraisal Process and provide Feedback Data to LM  Prepare/track/report on Config related metrics to measure quality and efficiency  Other related responsibilities may be assigned as required by the needs of the department and LM  Qualifications   Education: Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science or equivalent   Experience: 2+ years of relevant experience   Additional Skills   Computer Science graduation / Programming Certified  Experience in application development with .Net (VB.Net,  C#),  PHP/XML,  and/or JAVA  Experience in web development with ASP,  ASP.Net,  HTML,  CSS and/or Java Script / VBScript / Groovy Script  Experience with SQL programming  Knowledge and Experience with object- oriented programming  Ability to successfully balance multiple projects and timelines  Ability to liaise successfully with other team members  Ability to understand and program a design of low levels of complexity  Ability to successfully balance multiple projects and timelines  Problem solving and debugging skills RoleSoftware Developer,Industry TypePharma, Biotech, Clinical Research,Functional AreaIT Software - Application Programming, Maintenance,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryProgramming & DesignEducationUG :Any Graduate in Any SpecializationPG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsComputer scienceVB SCRIPTProcess improvementXMLWeb developmentPHPHTMLMedical writingTechnical supportSQL

description: Job descriptionPentagon Consultancy Services | HR Consultants | Placement Consultants | Recruitment | job consultants | manpower consultancy | Bangalore, India Job Title : Hot openings for Data Analyst Skills : Data AnalystDescription : Greetings from Pentagon Consultancy Services, Create SQL scripts to extract data from tables. Business Analysis skills with banking domain knowledge, Business communication skills. Candidate should handle direct communication with customers. Stakeholder management skills. Candidate should have worked on projects / support areas handing business requests. Should have experience on create Mapping documents, Test preparations, Data Modeling and SQL queriesUnderstand the business users requirements for information, features, and functions and communicate them to the rest of the application development and data warehouse team. Lead preparation of data warehouse requirements documents. Lead the identification and documentation of business metrics. Act as consultant to the PL1 front end programmers. Once business needs are defined for the data warehouse projects, the business analyst will be involved in designing and validating the logical data model that pro-vides a different representation of these requirements.  The Data Analyst will also play a role in data model design and prototyping and is involved in developing or validating source target mappings and transformation logic required to support information. The Data analyst may also assist in identifying data quality problems and in determining options for how they will be handled. The Data Analyst will also play a role in testing and validation and in delivering user training. Data analyst should help in Data modeling as per the business and DW requirements and review models to ascertain that requirements are met. Elicit requirements using interviews, data analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and workflow analysis. Become a subject matter expert on our Banking BFSI data, processes, META Data and business methodologies Decompose high-level business requirements into an appropriate level of business rules and detailed user, functional, and nonfunctional requirements using alternative views such as flows, diagrams, models, and use cases when applicable. Meet with users to gather requirements for project definition.  Analyze existing procedures and evaluate requested requirements to identify system changes. Assist in the creation of deliverables that are developed jointly with the user and the Product Development.  Includes product definition, logical design (business process and rules, data elements and flows, screens and reports), implementation plan, and documentation and training needs. Collaborate with technical staff to determine system specifications and requirements. Counsel and advise users on system capabilities and processes. Improve processes within the Company to increase the level and quality of service provided to internal and external customers. The Data Analyst will also be responsible for the Quality Assurance. Convert the requirements and design documents into a set of testing cases and scripts that can be used to verify that the system meets the client needs. Execute or supervise the execution of those test cases and scripts Facilitate or perform random testing of all components to ensure that a random bug is not haunting the system. Work with peers to ensure the final solution meets the highest quality. company: Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a diversified, community-based financial services company with $1.9 trillion in assets. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, Wells Fargo provides banking, insurance, investments, mortgage, and consumer and commercial finance through more than 8,600 locations, 13,000 ATMs, the internet (wellsfargo.com) and mobile banking, and has offices in 36 countries and territories to support customers who conduct business in the global economy. With approximately 268,000 team members, Wells Fargo serves one in three households in the United States. Wells Fargo & Company was ranked No. 27 on Fortunes 2016 rankings of Americas largest corporations. Wells Fargos vision is to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially
description: Job description   About the role       This is a Senior Individual Contributor role supporting CR Control group. This TM's role is to be a strong SME in Reporting and Analytics scope of work to Consult, to define, document what we do, how we do etc.    The individual will be responsible for aggregating/disaggregating metrics and complex datasets, perform practical business analysis, and develop and present insights in a meaningful and easy to understand manner.    This role may expand to other risk based activities over time.       Responsibilities       The role is expected to have the SME capacity in Reporting and Analytics to support Corporate Risk group including Compliance, Operational Risk, Credit/Market/Counterparty Risk, Model risk etc.    Provide ongoing broad, enterprise-wide analysis and insights of risk from front line activities throughout Corporate Risk, using risk intelligence tools and advanced analytics capabilities to identify emerging trends for front line risk related issues and transforming data into information and actionable insights    Lead the strategic analysis, consolidation, summary and presentation of results to deliver meaningful insights and actionable information to key business leaders across the company to help drive decisions and change, across the enterprise    Owning the development and use of statistical, mathematical and predictive analysis using strategic business understanding to build the mapping and algorithms necessary to derive actionable insights from patterns, trends and correlations from within data sets    Ensuring proactive leadership execution by staying appraised of all assigned initiatives, and providing analytic outputs in compelling graphical, numerical and other narrative forms that will allow informed, data-driven decisions to meet business objectives and reduce risk    Working with SME's, domain and risk program leaders to capture reporting requirements, and integrate their independent observations and point-of-views into reports    Developing high-quality, validated, and trusted risk reports that ensures an accurate depiction of risk, risk trends and change-in-risk states    Lead and execute the Quality Assurance program for Reporting Analytics vertical.    Building automated data quality processes and validation routines to reduce manual validation efforts    Developing and maintaining strong working relationships with the line of business, corporate regulatory, operational risk and compliance peers    Performs review activities and overlooking the nuances of the team to implement all key processes    Be a SME and guide functionally and provide training as necessary.    Accountable to train TM s on day to day functional delivery and to ensure quality is maintained.    Accountable for BAU documentation creation/change management including process documentation, job aids, process flows, templates for execution and any materials required to perform the in scope activities.    Review and implement Enterprise policy and procedure requirements that applies to Corp Risk scope of work.    Accountable to provide input into business as usual development via lessons learned, continuous improvement etc.    Execute WFEGS specific Risk/Reporting initiatives. description: Job description     Job Summary    Rubrik has become the fastest growing enterprise startup in Silicon Valley. We are seeking a  passionate and highly driven Sales Process & Automation Analyst to join the Sales  Operations team! The Sales Operations team is integral to the success of the Sales  organization by helping to drive revenue and sales productivity. This position is located in our  Bangalore, India office.   Where you can make an impact:  Drive SFDC & CPQ projects and enhancements from start to finish requirements  analysis, consensus building, hand off for technical execution by IT, testing,  documentation, and launch / training.  Manage and coordinate testing and feedback from business users.  Drive prioritization and execution of SFDC & CPQ projects/enhancements in bi - weekly  releases  Implement new SKUs or SKU changes into CPQ in alignment with product strategy  Collaborate with business stakeholders and IT to implement effective and resilient  solutions.  In coordination with IT, own day to day maintenance of SFDC and exception processes.  Serve as escalation point for SFDC systems issues, troubleshooting, and problem  resolution in partnership with IT.  Manage CPQ systems audit and data clean up processes.  Develop and maintain field facing documentation and videos of SFDC and CPQ  processes.  Deliver simple, reliable, and scalable operational processes and systems for Sales  Find opportunities for process improvement and efficiency, suggest systems  improvements  Proactively assess upstream solutions to avoid downstream business, IT process, and  data impacts.  Provide highest standards of systems support to sales organization  Who you are:  Strategic thinker: Evaluate things holistically and for the long term, make decisions using  strong blend of technical chops and understanding of sales needs  Highly productive: Ability to be highly productive with little oversight on day to day basis.  This role is intended for somebody who will take meaningful responsibility and initiative  for shaping and executing upon our strategy and operations.  Ability to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT  partners. . Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)     Individuals seeking employment at this company are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements. Job descriptionGraduate in any discipline with good academic record. Graduates preferably from B.Com , BBM , BBA , BCA , B.Sc. Maths and Statistics education background.

About E2open: 

Founded in 2000 , E2open provides the largest and most comprehensive Supply Chain Operating Network , including a broad suite of collaborative supply chain solutions. Leading global enterprises rely on E2open to provide greater end- to- end visibility , more accurate data and insights , and real- time business process orchestration across complex , multi- enterprise trading partner networks. 

Businesses recognize that effective supply chain operations are the key to sustainable competitive advantage and shareholder value. E2open works with the world s largest manufacturers and brand owners across a variety of industries to deliver a highly responsive , integrated network of partners , based on accurate , actionable information. 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Execute Zyme channel visibility services for clients. Collect , consolidate , and analyze client point of sale and inventory information. 

Execute production process according to process documentation , quality assurance procedures to ensure sustainable , high quality deliverables. 

Develop strong understanding of Zyme internal tools and technology used to optimize data consolidation and reconciliation services 

Recommend ways to improve process , documentation , internal tools and technology to make daily work flow stable and error- free. REQUIRED SKILLS: 

Comfortable with computers , technology and utilizing software (Microsoft Excel , Access , other) to perform business analysis. 

Intellectual curiosity , detail orientation and desire to analyze and investigate trends/ patterns in data and information. COMMUNICATION 

Strong verbal and written communications skills , especially the ability to organize and articulate a well- structured argument. 

Strong personal interest in constantly improving communications skills and styles. Knowledge of Statistical Process Control techniques & concepts Education is an added advantage OTHER 

Knowledge of Statistical Process Control techniques & concepts Education is an added advantage

company: Dell is a Technology driven company with a unique Dell Direct model. Dell Information Technology department (Dell I/T) plays a key role in enabling the Dell Direct model by creating, deploying and supporting global industry-leading I/T assets and services that reliably deliver the best customer experience and competitive edge.
description: Job description  Job Title    Commercial Business Management - Sales Planning & Strategy Advisor    Job Location -  Bangalore, India   Job Grade  -  I7   Job Description:    This person will be a part of the team supporting the Global Go-to-Market (GTM) Insights and Analytics team for Commercial. The goal of this team is identifying, defining, analyzing and recommending potential new growth strategies for Dell's Commercial Business. Also, supporting strategic and operational projects from ideation through execution.    The person will be responsible for using robust data analytics skills and work with internal stakeholders and external partners to evaluate customer segments, Go-To-Market & Route-To-Market models, and build specific actionable recommendations to improve Dell's GTM. The candidate will have hands-on analytics capabilities and expertise in problem-solving techniques.    Role Responsibilities    Implements data driven process improvements for workgroup to improve customer experience and productivity  Assists with implementation of solutions that are thorough, practical, and consistent with functional or customer objectives based on analytics  Recommends and implements sales force performance strategies and tracking models on the basis of analytical findings.  Supports key strategic initiatives, and the development of long-term growth plans and profitability objectives  Collects and analyzes data required for modelling and other project objectives  Identifies and evaluates product and segment strategies, using qualitative and quantitative research  Supports writing reports, presentations, memos, and other communications and possesses excellent listening, persuasion, presentation and communication skills  Works cross-functionally to gain buy-in, support, and assistance for the project goals during and after project lifecycle from data perspective  Tracks and monitors project work plans, including objectives, tasks and time frames to ensure deliverables are completed on time  Responds to changing project circumstances and communicates issues to project leadership  Drive deep integration with key program stakeholders, understand business & program objectives, assess impact on metrics,  Provide appropriate depth of analysis leading to actionable recommendations, identify low-hanging fruit, ideation and development of business impact ideas in conjunction with program managers, inputs for continuous business improvements  Demonstrated excellence in handling ambiguity, working in multi-disciplinary teams, having a 'can-do' attitude and strong desire to learn & development  Support Global Go-To-Market transformation programs and initiatives to assist profitable growth of the commercial business while leveraging excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Translate strategic vision into data/information requirements and transform the data gathered from various sources into an analytical environment. description: Job descriptionJ.P. Morgan is a leading global financial services firm, established over 200 years ago: o We are the leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. o We have assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide o We operate in more than 100 markets. o We have more than 243,000 employees globally.  Our wholesale businesses include J.P. Morgans Asset Management, Commercial Banking and the Corporate& Investment Bank which provide products and services to corporations, governments, municipalities, non-profits, institutions, financial intermediaries and high-net worth individuals and families.  Our corporate functions support the entire organization and include the following functions: Accounting, Audit, Finance, Human Resources, Operations, and Technology.  J.P. Morgan in India provides a comprehensive range of Corporate & Investment Banking, Commercial Banking, Asset & Wealth Management, and Corporate functions services and solutions to our clients, executing some of the most important financial transactions and providing essential strategic advice to our clients such as the government, large domestic and multi-national corporations, non-government organizations and financial institutions and investors. India is a key market for JPMorgan Chase globally and our employees in India are a critical part of how we do business globally and are integrated within our businesses. Our Global Service Centres (GSCs) are strategically positioned in Mumbai, Bangalore and Hyderabad to support the firms operations regionally and globally. The centres provide comprehensive strategic support across technology and business operations processing to all lines of business and the corporate functions.    Job Description:   Data analytics and Risk reporting team is part of Home Lending within CCB Risk organization. Team will be extensively involved in design and development of effective information management solutions for Modeling, Loss Forecasting and Regulatory reporting like CCAR, CECL and ICAAP with highest standards of Data Quality, Data governance and Risk Reporting. description:
Job description

Position: ASSOCIATE ANALYST /  ANALYST

Experience: 0- 2 years

Job Location: Bangalore

Qualification: Graduate in any discipline with good academic record. Degree in business ,

mathematics , BCA and experience in data industry

About E2open: 

Founded in 2000 , E2open provides the largest and most comprehensive Supply Chain Operating Network , including a broad suite of collaborative supply chain solutions. Leading global enterprises rely on E2open to provide greater end- to- end visibility , more accurate data and insights , and real- time business process orchestration across complex , multi- enterprise trading partner networks. 

Businesses recognize that effective supply chain operations are the key to sustainable competitive advantage and shareholder value. E2open works with the world s largest manufacturers and brand owners across a variety of industries to deliver a highly responsive , integrated network of partners , based on accurate , actionable information. 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

The Analyst will be a high performing member of the Analytics Delivery Team within E2Open. He/ she will have two key areas of responsibility

1) Supporting the regular processes owned by the Analytics delivery team

2) Constantly improving the associated production processes.

The analyst is expected to be strong technically and must enjoy and be excited by technology. He/ she must be able to use these tools effectively and innovatively to make significant contribution to the team. 

The position will provide a great platform for professional development of an individual interested in building analytical skills , communication , and business judgment. 

REQUIRED SKILLS: 

Technical

Excellent Excel skills -  comfort with pivots , functions and experience of designing small models within excel is a must. Experience with macros is a big plus. 

Ability to quickly pick up new skills/ technical abilities as required 

Expertise at applying advanced statistical and programming tools to improve the efficiency and breadth of analytical capabilities 

Identify potential areas of automation within the production process Analytics 

Superior analytical skills and structured problem- solving skills , background in basic statistical methods 

Ability to think in a fresh and innovative manner without feeling limited by the existing way of doing things . 

Ability to derive conclusions and inferences from data metrics 

Excellent written communications skills , with an emphasis on use of visuals and charts to clearly communicate analytical findings. Able to provide examples of past written/ graphical communications. 

Ability to receive and incorporate feedback on work products and written communications. 

Strong verbal communications skills , especially the ability to organize and articulate a well structured argument. 

Strong personal interest in constantly improving communications skills and styles.
